column1: Hey everyone, I have a Passo 2010 that I am looking to get completely repainted. Due to the previous owners carelessness most of the clear coat on the car has faded in different places and the footboards have also begun to rust. I am getting it painted and have come to an agreement with a painter nearby in Johar (Karachi) for 45k for the complete denting and repainting of the car. Now I have no clue how the painters and denters here skimp out on work so I am looking for any pointers I should be looking for when they are doing the body work and paint job, any precautions and tips would be appreciated. I will post pictures of the car by tonight. I have done professional detailing, and still do it for friends and family when needed so I do have a good idea of what a good paint job looks like and I am familiar with the process of painting a car i.e body work, filling, sanding, primer, sanding, base coat, clear coat, wet sanding, compounding, polishing, no wax for a couple of weeks. The color of the car is pearl beige, almost the color of sand. The paint I have agreed upon is Nexa for base and clear. I will be going with the painter to fetch the paint. Any other brands recommended, are there fake paint products in the market? Appreciate any input!
column2: Take this with a grain of salt as nowadays people are complaining that Im blunt/rude etc. - but I have painted/refinished cars myself there are tons of cheap and fake stuff available which can bite you. This is why you need to find a good supplier. Secondly the air compressor you are using should be large enough to not short cycle constantly and you should have a very good moisture separator so you are not shooting water with the paint. The paint gun should be learned so the amount of spray can be dialed to the person handling the gun. A cheap gun results in bad finish. Use correct techniques to prep the paint including pepper coating to see the high and low sanding areas. Spraying it is also an issue as its easy to shoot dry spray which will result in a dead finish. Buy some mixing cups with measurements and ratios printed on the side of it and follow the manufacturer specs of the clear coat and its catalyser to get the correct ratio - do not try to "andaaza" it - it never works. (been there done that) - 3 wet coats of standox 2K clear will give you a very good finish provided you have sprayed the base correctly and evenly with a 30% overlap. Tape/disconnect/remove anything you can to get a clean/crisp finish everywhere. lastly - be safe, painting a car is hazardous to your health and can kill you so buy a respirator. Do not try to be He-man and commando the job with andaaza and no calculations or no safety. If you or your painter dont care then you might as well burn your money in a pile.

column1: I have been doing a little digging on the interwebs - a couple forums caught my site My Analysis of the Use of Low Zinc (zddp) Oil in C4 Corvettes8 <------------apparently this guy has access to academic research papers. Links to said papers are in the thread. GM debunks ZDDP myths for flat tappet cams11 <---------BITOG members' opinions I have just quickly skimmed through these posts - I will do a detailed reading later on. In the mean time, other members are welcome to read through them and give their opinions. There have been documented incidences of valvetrain failures on flat tappet engines, but they seem to involve hot rods, old school muscle cars, or stock cars used in racing applications. I will post some links later. Any members here with valvetrain failures using SM/SN oil in stock flat tappet engines? Please share your experiences.
column2: the zinc content reduction was solely done for purpose of not killing the "kitty cat" in the exhaust, this created many issues and along the way many manufacturers went to roller assembly like rockers - e.g. GM flat tappet engines are ancient now, even in the old API SG days, most american engines had hydraulic lifters in OHV engines (infact being lazy - they (GM) kept on using the damn things). As engine tech goes further - development in the gasoline engine arena has taken a few leaps n bounds - almost all engines now employ either bucket over valve, roller rocker (inverted or straight doesnt matter) - smaller high pressure bearing surfaces etc. (Pakistan is still using 40 or even 50 year old engine technology) such old school oils while they are easy to buy in Pakistan and are cheaper - they are incredibly hard to find in other countries due to being obsolete and also to somewhat protect the interests of the manufacturer (idiot car owners will pour it in and wonder why the eff their cats are dead in half the time - while the federal warranty of a cat converter in a brand new car in USA is 7 years). as ahsanzs said - a cheap econo engine is pretty worthless if it takes a Rs 20,000/- oil change. So why challenge the situation. I personally think that if you operate the machinery under control specification and dont find an issue with longevity or performance then leave it alone. Only go about looking for other solutions when your control specification is either bad or cannot be implemented any longer (e.g. oils not available)

column2: the problem what suzuki created is that they simply slapped a cat converter onto a poor engine which already was quite dirty exhaust - adding EFI does not magically clean the exhaust out if your cylinder head design is incredibly poor. Its cam is not aggressive but does have flat tappets non the less and strong valve springs too. It does face the brute forces of the valve train due to which such oils were blended. Cat converters have been employed even in engines specifying API SJ oils and some even SH (infact havoline motor oil when first launched in Pakistan had that written proudly that it is perfectly suited for cars with cat converters - which half the population of Pakistan did not know what it was despite being in all the darling EE-80, EE 90 corollas with 2E-LU engines.. Everyone promptly filled with PSO 30/40 tin and called it a day - misrouted vacuum hoses, misfires which cooked the cat and slowly the engines died a strange death (some including fires)

column2: ayan_cdkey;4768717: Challenge?? Definitely not! Mere observations I have. Well baleno was in production till 2005, so the manual is pretty outdated. If baleno had been under production now then definitely it would have had api sm or sn as requirement in the book. Cultus efi has the same technology and I never found the api requirements on the book. Probably the latest and best api grade should be used. People add zddp packs to api sn oils because they have been using muscle cars or classic engines. I am sure our flat tappet suzukis dont undergo that much strain or pressure. So api sm and sn should be fine. Above all, u can see that delo is also now api sL. In a matter of time, they will be available in api sn too. So the outdated api grades such as sL, sj or sg will be off the shelves soon, toh suzuki owners will inevitably have to shift to api sn or sm Please check your placement on the map - I beleive its Pakistan. there are no safety or emmissions mandates in that country - meaning there is no one to check exhaust emmissions or even vehicular safety. the reason to remove such high pressure additives was to save the cat converter from dying early, As it created another host of problems, most (sensible) manufacturers employed different technologies to remove the high pressure areas in their engines (roller cams, bucket/shim/hydraulic/solid tappets etc) - Pakistan has no mandate to have a cat converter - infact this very forum has a ton of threads of people advising to remove the cat because it affects "parfarminss" of their econocar. your beloved cultus efi has the same old ancient "buzurg" G series suzi 4 cyl engine that we have been seeing since we were roaming around in shorts, it still uses a soft cam and silly rockers with a pretty silly breathing setup aka, choked design - meaning rev more. Be assured that ancient API - SC, SE, SG, SH, SL - CH4, CI and CJ oils are not going anywhere from shelves in Pakistan, the insane numbers of Honda CD70E and CG125E and ancient mazda and bedford diesel engines in Pakistan will fail catastrophically in short time. Your cars are the drop in the bucket (those motorcycles and the trucks are entire water the bucket) - please add the first paragraph to this mix and you will know why it would be "a huge loss" to remove such oils from the shelves.

column2: ahmedraja1996;4766729: Mehran was the only car i had with flat tappets, i didn't knew much about ZDDP but these engines were designed when SF SG oils were available. nowdays finding SE SF SG ain't easy. And test was done on cars having same mileage same year but different oils. Car A was tested on 20W50 SG and Car B was on 10W40 SN. Car B had extremely clean engine compared to Car A when both cars clocked 50K km. Car B had better fuel consumption and cam was neat. Drain interval was different, Car A had 2.5K OCI and Car B had 3.5K OCI. Atm Car B is driven 170k and Car A is 150k but Car A needs valves, reducing qt after 1k. Car B till now has no issues. Its my own experience i don't take responsibility for anyone else's car engine problems. since suzuki still makes mehran, it also makes oil for it, which is 10w40 sgo premium. for those who say newer is better, please explain why suzuki would want api sg 10w40 while they also have 10w40 in sm grade (sgo ultimate)

column2: curveeditor;4910760: اَلسَّــلاَمُ عَلَيــكُـم I have installed Nissan Twin cam 1.6. Now i m facing a problem with its fuel pump. I changed it three times. after some days its goes loss its pressure. what i do ??? and please suggest me any good mechanic for its engine in Rawalpindi or Islamabad. بہت شکریہ ۔۔ walaikum salam, has anyone done any diagnosis testing on it or are you trying to shoot parts at the car so it fixes itself? check the voltage at the pump, low voltage will lead to higher amp pull which can kill the pump, check the fuel pressure regulator for faulty operation. how old is the fuel filter if this is a swapped engine, was the fuel supply line changed to a larger diameter one? Are you installing used/scrapped fuel pumps? an injector balance test is also recommended but it would be very alien for the average old mechanic in Pakistan.

column1: Can anyone who is familiar with tools and ratchets, and general car maintaince stuff tell me what brand I should go for that is easily available in Pakistan. Which brands have good quality socket sets or what should I look before buying one.
column2: Snap on tooling is not for diy level at all, just one socket goes for about 30 dollars a piece. A spanner set gets upto 500 dollars. Elora is a good brand and is available but their ratchets are garbage because they have thicker teeth count, you can look for koken and nikki tools, some sellers have ancient old stock for sale. A tool should be chunky and heavy and should not flex if its correctly hardened. (Chrome sockets), black impact grade sockets are softer.

column1: Can anyone who is familiar with tools and ratchets, and general car maintaince stuff tell me what brand I should go for that is easily available in Pakistan. Which brands have good quality socket sets or what should I look before buying one.
column2: What was the price of the 3/8 torque wrench? And can you specify the model type? Is it a split beam, clicker, Torqometer, or digital?

column1: Can anyone who is familiar with tools and ratchets, and general car maintaince stuff tell me what brand I should go for that is easily available in Pakistan. Which brands have good quality socket sets or what should I look before buying one.
column2: Go to market and find a big toolshop, ask them for taiwanese tools, they will show you some, check that the sockets have rounded milling at thr hex corners as that wont chew the nut and bolt face, also buy 6 sided stuff as it can take a better beating compared to 12 sided. You should have some 12 sided stuff too for some specific conditions like oldschool honda flywheel bolts. Good luck. Some brands I remember in pk were tony or king dick, one brand I forgot its name was actually from Czech republic, they looked very rough and thick but were incredibly durable and very heavy, you attach a 1/2 ratchet to it and your pinky could undo the bolts. My favorite werr elora and gedore/hazet but they were pricey.

column1: Can anyone who is familiar with tools and ratchets, and general car maintaince stuff tell me what brand I should go for that is easily available in Pakistan. Which brands have good quality socket sets or what should I look before buying one.
column2: Oh these They are acceptable quality as beginner toolset, their ratchets are weak though. And make sure to get the 6 point sockets. They were available here for a small timeframe and were best as gifts or keep a set in a car for emergencies.

column1: Can anyone who is familiar with tools and ratchets, and general car maintaince stuff tell me what brand I should go for that is easily available in Pakistan. Which brands have good quality socket sets or what should I look before buying one.
column2: Every brand is available in market. Look at the quality as some local sockets are better then chinese branded ones. Go to the market and compare yourself. Ingco brand is new in market but highly overpriced.

column1: Can anyone who is familiar with tools and ratchets, and general car maintaince stuff tell me what brand I should go for that is easily available in Pakistan. Which brands have good quality socket sets or what should I look before buying one.
column2: Quality can be easily distinguish. Cheap sockets will have rough edges and will not be tight fit on nut/bolt, same with screw drivers while ratchets will feel loose and the clicking noise would be different. This can be my opinion only. When you start using tools you will differentiate them easily.

column2: Salam Pakwheelers, -  - Can anyone please help me find a Navigation SD Card for a Civic 2010 In Dash Player? I recently purchased a used 2010 Civic but noticed that the Navigation SD Card is missing. Any help would be greatly appreciated. @rizwan400, I am willing to pay if anyone is willing to sell a working SD card at an affordable price. Thank you in advance. -  - Dear Naveed, Japanese cars that have a built-in navigation system usually come with a map DVD, but that map would be of Japan, which is not useful in Pakistan. You haven't mentioned clearly what the problem is. Is the system not playing any audio CDs as well? If other audio CDs are also not playing, then the system needs to be booted using a boot CD, but it is necessary to know the model number of your system for that. Please post the model number of your system, and if you need a boot CD, it can be provided. The navigation DVD won't be of any use to you because the map will be for Japan.

column1: Salamz Pakwheelers, Can anyone please help me to get Navigation SD Card For Civic 2010 In Dash Player. Just bought a used 2010 civic but just noticed that Navigation Sd Card is missing. Any help would be highly appreciated. @rizwan400 Willing to pay if anyone willing to sell a working sd card on some affordable price. Thanks in advance.
column2: I am talking about a Honda Civic 2010, not a Japanese car. The indash dvd player of the Honda Civic Reborn has a navigation sd card with maps. I have lost mine. If you think this post can help, you can download and try the Honda DVD Satellite Navigation System. It was released in 2014 and the version is 3.80. The disc includes countries from Eastern Europe and Western Europe. The supported languages are English, German, and Italian. This system is compatible with various Honda models including Legend, Accord, CR-V, Civic, CR-Z, and Insight. The Honda 2012 Satellite Navigation DVD V3.80 offers updated maps that provide information on routes, new roads, detours, petrol stations, hospitals, restaurants, and other facilities. It is recommended to use WinRAR version 4.0.1 or higher to unzip the files and ImgBurn 2.5.4.0 or later version to record the DVD. It is also important to use a VERBATIM DVD+R DL disc with a maximum write speed of 4X. After recording, make sure to check the contents of the disk for any errors. During the update process, the engine should be kept on permanently. Insert the recorded disc and the update process will start automatically. If it doesn't, follow the steps mentioned. Please note that you perform all these actions at your own risk.

column1: Salamz Pakwheelers, Can anyone please help me to get Navigation SD Card For Civic 2010 In Dash Player. Just bought a used 2010 civic but just noticed that Navigation Sd Card is missing. Any help would be highly appreciated. @rizwan400 Willing to pay if anyone willing to sell a working sd card on some affordable price. Thanks in advance.
column2: Dear Naveed, Japanese cars come with a built-in navigation system, which includes a map DVD. However, the map on the DVD is usually for Japan, which is useless in Pakistan. You did not clearly explain what the problem is. Is the issue that no audio CDs are playing? If other audio CDs are also not playing, then you may need to boot the system using a boot CD. For that, it is necessary to know the model number of your system. Please provide the model number of your system, and if you need a boot CD, it can be arranged. The navigation DVD will not be of any use to you because the map is for Japan. Also, as I mentioned before, I am talking about a Honda Civic 2010, not a Japanese car. The Honda Civic Reborn has an indash DVD player with a navigation SD card that contains the maps. I have lost mine, and there is no need for a maps DVD in this case.

column1: Car is Toyota Passo 2012 . Did not like the sound of the orignal 12w speakers plus no speakers in the rear dash . Already done that DIY . Tools used  Started by removing the top Cover grill of the speakers. very easy just pry on the edges with a plastic wedge.  This is the terminal you have to dissconnect.  The new speakers Sony Xplod GTF 1038 .These are 4 inch speakers.  Cut the original Terminal and install these two splices.  Along with that installed the speaker terminals.  install the new speakers Note that i had to cut the Alternate bolt hook for proper fitting they were interfering with the sides.  Terminals attached and speaker is placed .  Installed Picture .closed the grill after checking the operation.  Hope this helps a lot of passo owners DIY took 30 mins for each side if you have proper tools .
column2: i am not a very big fan of Audio setups. sound has improved a lot along with the rear door speakers. they are 6 inches . The only thing to be taken care of is only Sony xplod's have a bolt on fitting for the rear doors.

column1: One of our cars is parked a lot, 10-15 days at a time between uses and we keep getting Low battery warning. Thinking of getting a battery charger to top up the battery each week to avoid battery damage. Can someone recommend a high-quality battery charger?
column2: None of the locally available battery chargers are any good. Even Chinese ones aren't that great. Lead acid batteries require very precise voltages to charge, and go through bulk, absorption, and float charging stages. Bulk charging is constant current, absorption is constant voltage (14.4V - 14.7V) and float is 13.20V, with temperature-dependent voltage compensation. If you examine a locally-sourced charger, you'll find they don't have nearly enough components to monitor or manage these variables. Also note that your car battery is not a "deep-cycle" battery, meaning if you're letting it get very very low, it can only handle about 10-15 full discharge cycles before it irreversibly loses capacity and becomes unserviceable. However, SIMTEK, I believe, makes a 12V battery charger that may be decent. I have not examined one myself, but I own a SIMTEK UPS that has decent construction and quality components. Good quality imported chargers such as the Noco Genius may be available abroad. You might be served well by a battery "tender" - a trickle charger that keeps the battery topped up.

column1: I have been into car detailing for a while now, courtesy "car care and detailing dreams" (parent thread) and specially Ahmad Bhai ( @ahmad_yar ) who has been there to help like its his duty I actually stumbled into car detailing by chance in an effort to rectify an issues and once I got into it, I just kept going further. Initially starting with locally available Meguiars and there came the desire to acquire some great products and AlhamduLillah now I possess some high end detailing products. In my car details, you will see me use a variety of products (almost all acquired internationally and mostly unheard of that not many around use). By profession, I am an IT professional, so with the time I get to spend on computer I started making myself knowledgable about car detailing, participating in international forums, the various sorts of products that are out there from all vendors and which combos are best suited for different color categories, identifying my wish list (if and when anyone travels that can bring it along) and how it all fits into the picture end to end. While some of you have seen my detailing posts from time to time and provided great feedback, I decided to create a thread of my own so that my information is in one place and that I can actually organise this thread with information/car details in one place. This isn't a thread to compete with the parent detailing thread and I will continue to be a part of it like I have always been. Given the scarcity of detailing threads, I would encourage you all (who are interested in this domain) to subscribe to this thread and keep visiting and I anticipate a lot of good stuff coming from me on this thread InshAllah. If you use your mobile mostly to visit PW forums (via PW app or tapatalk), feel free to drop a response here so that this post starts showing up in your "Participated" menu so you can keep tabs on this thread. I will post the links here to the various car detail sessions that I've done and shared on the parent thread in the last year or so. Currently i drive a vitz AlhamduLillah and used to have a 95 jdm corolla which was replaced by 06 white civic (family car). Some of the cars I've detailed, see post #2 for links to the details. Vitz (captured in the market via cell phone, image cropped from a larger picture taken from a distance). In this picture, its wearing the werkstat acrylic range. Corolla (captured by a pro with his DSLR). Car was sold earlier in 2014. I will post the links here to the various car detail sessions that I've done and shared on the parent thread in the last year or so. Currently i drive a vitz AlhamduLillah and used to have a 95 jdm corolla which was replaced by 06 white civic (family car). Some of the cars I've detailed, see post #2 for links to the details. Vitz (captured in the market via cell phone, image cropped from a larger picture taken from a distance). In this picture, its wearing the werkstat acrylic range. column1: I have been into car detailing for a while now, courtesy "car care and detailing dreams" (parent thread) and specially Ahmad Bhai ( @ahmad_yar ) who has been there to help like its his duty I actually stumbled into car detailing by chance in an effort to rectify an issues and once I got into it, I just kept going further. Initially starting with locally available Meguiars and there came the desire to acquire some great products and AlhamduLillah now I possess some high end detailing products. In my car details, you will see me use a variety of products (almost all acquired internationally and mostly unheard of that not many around use). By profession, I am an IT professional, so with the time I get to spend on computer I started making myself knowledgable about car detailing, participating in international forums, the various sorts of products that are out there from all vendors and which combos are best suited for different color categories, identifying my wish list (if and when anyone travels that can bring it along) and how it all fits into the picture end to end. While some of you have seen my detailing posts from time to time and provided great feedback, I decided to create a thread of my own so that my information is in one place and that I can actually organise this thread with information/car details in one place. This isn't a thread to compete with the parent detailing thread and I will continue to be a part of it like I have always been. Given the scarcity of detailing threads, I would encourage you all (who are interested in this domain) to subscribe to this thread and keep visiting and I anticipate a lot of good stuff coming from me on this thread InshAllah. column1: Hi, Can any one advise me that what are the symptoms if tappet/valves setting are not fine? I have vario 05 BR
column2: onlyfaith;3225689: sorry for the late BUMP but can you guys tell me what is the role of engine oil lubrication for tappet noise, i mean can a bad engine oil lead to tappet noise. role of engine lubricant is CRUCIAL ONE. Yes bad oil or lack of lubricant can damage anything in an engine. imagine a warm fresh nan you can eat plain. leave the same nan open in plate it will dry in a while with an effort you can surely eat it but will cause trouble for sure.

column1: I got these bf goodrich tyres today I noticed this crack on the side wall The tyres are fresh and not thề smuggled ones rathers these are imported ones I just got worried as these are expensive and are these safe for hot weather or not , can someone guide mế regarding this!
column2: this fracture is dangerous. can cause abrupt burst if there are cat-eyes over the road. If new get it replaced soonest, please.

column1: Asalam o Alaikum, Pakwheelers! Keeping the project cars streak alive since 2016, I'm back with another interesting, fun yet AFFORDABLE project. The legendary Suzuki Khyber a.k.a Suzuki Swift MK1 a.k.a Holden Barina a.k.a Chevrolet Sprint a.k.a Pontiac Firefly. Introduced as Suzuki Swift globally in 1983 at the 25th Tokyo Motor Show, this generation was around for over a decade and was sold under different badges thanks to the alliance between Suzuki and GM. I've always wanted a 2 door CLUB CULTUS or Suzuki Forsa or Suzuki Swift MK1, whatever you call it, I've always admired these 2 door hatches from Suzuki, it's always been on my list but sadly, there aren't many around for sale and the ones that are? THEY'RE DEMANDING A FORTUNE FOR THOSE CRACKED COOKIES Moving on, I found myself a Suzuki Khyber and I thought? I SHOULD BUY IT Why? Well! Here's the list of reasons . CHEAP AND RUNNING ON A SUZUKI G10 MOTOR . AFFORDABLE TO RESTORE . NO ANNUAL TAXES BECAUSE PUNJAB REGD WITH LIFETIME TAX EXEMPTION . EASY AVAILABILITY OF PARTS . BUS BHAI ITNA HI, KHYBER HAI! WHAT WORKS IN THIS CAR? NOTHING WHAT DOESN'T WORKS IN THIS CAR? EVERYTHING I go nuts when I'm doing projects and many pakwheelers are familiar with that, if you're not, check them out below! DAIHATSU CHARADE 1989 The Rebuild - Daihatsu Charade CB100 D.I.Y Projects Asalam o Alaikum fellow Pakwheelers I'm starting this thread on behalf of my brother @ranahamza89 who is going to be rebuilding his Daihatsu Charade CB100 1989 from scratch. The car's condition is all rusty and rough, running on Toyota 1KR FE (Vitz 1000cc) The interior requires a lot of work as well, the pictures will be enough to tell, but things will start getting better with time and we both have decided not to rush it. We both have been planning on getting the car done but since both of u… MAZDA RX8 Bringing my RX back to life - Mazda RX8 1JZ VVTi Mazda Asalam o alaikum everyone. Months ago, I got my hands on a Mazda RX8 2005. The car was swapped with a 2JZGTE by the previous owner but I bought the car without any engine under the hood. It was parked in a plot for months and the owner wasn't willing to sell it but after 2 months of procrastination, I finally got my hands on it. The car was and still is in a pretty bad condition, the last owner had the car showered in matte blue, then matte pink and currently the car is showered in matte yellow … HONDA ACCORD CA5 Built Not Bought - Honda Accord CA5 1989 3G D.I.Y Projects Salam everyone! I hope everyone's doing well, my Mazda RX8 is finally home & now? It was finally time for myself to get another car to play with, after throwing in money for those huge bills on the RX8, I was looking to get an affordable, yet a different project, I honestly was thinking of getting a Suzuki Swift MK1 (2 door) for myself but as I was going through my routine pakwheels surfing, I came across an ad that blew my mind & I actually made a blind deal, here she is! The Honda Accord 3G it… HONDA CIVIC EK3 Built Not Bought S2 - PROJEKT Honda Civic EK3 Technical Forums Asalam o Alaikum, pakwheelers! I was already undergoing a project on my BMW E39 but it needs a lot of time and tbh, a lot of money too, therefore, I thought of pausing it for a while, meanwhile, I have started working on this Honda Civic EK3. The specs of this specific car are listed below . Powered by a Honda D15A SOHC motor . Stick shift . Nothing fancy except for the mesh grill and the front bumper lip . 15" Vossen replicas . The car is originally finished in New Vogue Silver Metallic . The… BMW E39 540i Built Not Bought 2.0 - BMW E39 540i M62 4.4L V8 D.I.Y Projects Asalam o Alaikum, fellow pakwheelers! Hope you all are doing great, this is going to be my 5th project that I'll be documenting on pakwheels but 11th in general. I was in search of the perfect budget V8 that I could use on a daily basis and maintaining it wouldn't be a pain in the ass. A car that I can drive everyday but enjoy on weekends. This is our 8th german but this E39 holds a special place in my heart as this is the first BMW that I bought from my own earnings. Coming to the specs, let's … Subscribe to my YouTube channel for some dope episodes of this build! www.youtube.com/abdulmunimqadri6 Here are the pictures of the car To chalein jee, BISMILLAH to another project car, stay tuned, guys!
column2: There is one for sale on olx. Seen it's add recently. 160k i think. Asking too much for local engine though. Prefer m16 or m13. M series is new and light. Will perform better then G series.

The legendary Suzuki Khyber a.k.a Suzuki Swift MK1 a.k.a Holden Barina a.k.a Chevrolet Sprint a.k.a Pontiac Firefly. Introduced as Suzuki Swift globally in 1983 at the 25th Tokyo Motor Show, this generation was around for over a decade and was sold under different badges thanks to the alliance between Suzuki and GM. I've always wanted a 2 door CLUB CULTUS or Suzuki Forsa or Suzuki Swift MK1, whatever you call it, I've always admired these 2 door hatches from Suzuki, it's always been on my list but sadly, there aren't many around for sale and the ones that are? THEY'RE DEMANDING A FORTUNE FOR THOSE CRACKED COOKIES Moving on, I found myself a Suzuki Khyber and I thought? I SHOULD BUY IT Why? Well! Here's the list of reasons . CHEAP AND RUNNING ON A SUZUKI G10 MOTOR . AFFORDABLE TO RESTORE . NO ANNUAL TAXES BECAUSE PUNJAB REGD WITH LIFETIME TAX EXEMPTION . EASY AVAILABILITY OF PARTS . BUS BHAI ITNA HI, KHYBER HAI! WHAT WORKS IN THIS CAR? NOTHING WHAT DOESN'T WORKS IN THIS CAR? EVERYTHING I go nuts when I'm doing projects and many pakwheelers are familiar with that, if you're not, check them out below! DAIHATSU CHARADE 1989 The Rebuild - Daihatsu Charade CB100 D.I.Y Projects Asalam o Alaikum fellow Pakwheelers I'm starting this thread on behalf of my brother @ranahamza89 who is going to be rebuilding his Daihatsu Charade CB100 1989 from scratch. The car's condition is all rusty and rough, running on Toyota 1KR FE (Vitz 1000cc) The interior requires a lot of work as well, the pictures will be enough to tell, but things will start getting better with time and we both have decided not to rush it. We both have been planning on getting the car done but since both of u… MAZDA RX8 Bringing my RX back to life - Mazda RX8 1JZ VVTi Mazda Asalam o alaikum everyone. Months ago, I got my hands on a Mazda RX8 2005. The car was swapped with a 2JZGTE by the previous owner but I bought the car without any engine under the hood. It was parked in a plot for months and the owner wasn't willing to sell it but after 2 months of procrastination, I finally got my hands on it. The car was and still is in a pretty bad condition, the last owner had the car showered in matte blue, then matte pink and currently the car is showered in matte yellow … HONDA ACCORD CA5 Built Not Bought - Honda Accord CA5 1989 3G D.I.Y Projects Salam everyone! I hope everyone's doing well, my Mazda RX8 is finally home & now? It was finally time for myself to get another car to play with, after throwing in money for those huge bills on the RX8, I was looking to get an affordable, yet a different project, I honestly was thinking of getting a Suzuki Swift MK1 (2 door) for myself but as I was going through my routine pakwheels surfing, I came across an ad that blew my mind & I actually made a blind deal, here she is! The Honda Accord 3G it… HONDA CIVIC EK3 Built Not Bought S2 - PROJEKT Honda Civic EK3 Technical Forums Asalam o Alaikum, pakwheelers! I was already undergoing a project on my BMW E39 but it needs a lot of time and tbh, a lot of money too, therefore, I thought of pausing it for a while, meanwhile, I have started working on this Honda Civic EK3. The specs of this specific car are listed below . Powered by a Honda D15A SOHC motor . Stick shift . Nothing fancy except for the mesh grill and the front bumper lip . 15" Vossen replicas . The car is originally finished in New Vogue Silver Metallic . The… BMW E39 540i Built Not Bought 2.0 - BMW E39 540i M62 4.4L V8 D.I.Y Projects Asalam o Alaikum, fellow pakwheelers! Hope you all are doing great, this is going to be my 5th project that I'll be documenting on pakwheels but 11th in general. I was in search of the perfect budget V8 that I could use on a daily basis and maintaining it wouldn't be a pain in the ass. A car that I can drive everyday but enjoy on weekends. This is our 8th german but this E39 holds a special place in my heart as this is the first BMW that I bought from my own earnings. Coming to the specs, let's … Subscribe to my YouTube channel for some dope episodes of this build! www.youtube.com/abdulmunimqadri6 Here are the pictures of the car To chalein jee, BISMILLAH to another project car, stay tuned, guys!
column2: Seems like a tight fit. What about the angle of the steering column and steering. Visibility of cluster after intalling the steering. What about the gap between the stomach/legs /seats with steering? Your old AC saman will be useless. make sure that the cultus airbox/cooling system sites well behind the dash.

column1: I had my first bicycle when I was in the 1st grade perhaps, it was a BMX and my younger brother hand one as well but in a different color. As time passed by the bicycles kept on getting swapped or replaced as my parents believed it was an essential activity for kids. The last time I could remember riding a bike was in my matriculation period during which I used to ride back and forth to school and other places. Well now after a long break I have somehow re-developed an interest in building myself one. I went to the market and did an extensive research and there were many many brands chinese mostly and then there were used japanese one that were more expensive then new chinese ones. Luckily bicycles have tons of parts around and one can build one up-to their liking. I asked a friend who had one imported from Dubai(Japan Made, brand unknown) parked in his warehouse for a long time and he was generous enough to give it away. Even though I made him a promise that I wont spend much on it but I want to do it my way so stay put and enjoy the journey. The bicycle has been neglected and to add to the misery someone tried to paint it with a rattle can in silver destroying it’s beautiful skyblue finish, it is a bit rusty and sad but by the time I am done it will be a different machine iA. I asked them to disassemble it so that I can fit it inside the boot of my car so that I can move it around. Some pictures for reference.
column2: Extremely rare to see a bicycling enthusiast. Good luck with the restoration. Most of the year the weather in our country is inhospitality hot which is not conducive for cycling. Only in winter can a person cycle for pleasure. In addition, unruly traffic and poor roads also discourage cycling for pleasure or exercise. It's a pity but that's how it is. Though millions of under privileged people cycle to and from work daily in Pakistan in all types of weather. Hats off to them.

column2: Disassembling it further at home! It’s a diamond in the rough at-least that is how I see it Going to replace 90% of the accessories with brand new ones. Will be getting the frame painted by a professional painter and some of it’s bits powder coated along with new tyres, de-railers, brakes, center-axle, paddles, gear/brake levers, cables and much more. Luckily the frame is straight and doesn’t need much tweaking.

column2: So after I acquired the frame my research began on where to get the parts from. I am from Pindi, went to the local bicycle shops in the vicinity and took rates for various parts. I went to College Road as well which is considered to be the hub for bicycles. A shop keeper there told me to go to NeelaGumbad in Lahore as it one of the biggest wholesale markets for bicycles in the country. By luck I visited Lahore this weekend and visited the place and believe me the mashwara that person gave me was the best. There was a day and night difference between the rates which amazed me and I made a deal with one of the bicycle shops there. Got all the partssss 1. Tyres: Got Service Mountain Bike tyres and BMX brand tubes  2. Front crank set  3. Front and back de-railers  4. New Chain  5. Aluminium Paddles  6. Side stand  7. Grips  8. Handle bar with neck and stem  9. Brakes  10. Center tube axle  11. Gear and Brake levers  12. Gel seat  13. Bracket for seat adjustment  14. Cables

column2: cracked;4204562: this is because the fuel sensor is place on behind the fuel tank.wen you are ascending,the fuel goes on rear on tank and shows more fuel than actual and vice versa.My khyber has sensor on left side of tank so when i turn right,more fuel is shown and less when i turn sharp left..similarly,when i accelerate,the fuel gauge goes down and when im stopped at signal,fuel gauge rises very minute.its all because the gauge shows approx amount of fuel and not cent percent. Yeah , you're right!

column1: Assalam-o-Alaikum, -  - I got my Cultus 2018 model fully washed yesterday. I had the seats and carpets removed. When I started the car last night, I got these errors and after a while, the ABS signal started appearing as well. These warnings are not going away. I think water might have gotten into the sensor. Is there any solution for this, or do I need to take it to Suzuki? Here is the link to the picture I uploaded: [Insert Link] -  - Thank you.
column2: park your car in broad day light under sun with doors open, rear hatch engine hood open in sun direction. it is the moisture in cabin floor rug & engine bay triggering these alert signs.

column1: I have faw v2 2020. Winters pass by charm. As soon as summer starts it doesn't start after sitting under sunshine for an hour. Engine cranks properly. Battery is at 100% but car just don't want to start as if some sensor is stopping it. Got it checked from dealership, several mechanics, by obd. No one is able to diagnose. A GENUINEEEEEEEEEE ISSUE I let it cool by opening all windows for about half an hour to get it started. Anyone have any clue?
column2: Have you visited a legitimate proper workshop or just the dealer and random electrician? Does the ecu actually energize? Does the car have a tracker? Does the ecu command the fuel pump? There are a lot of parameters that need to agree for the engine to start.

column1: I have faw v2 2020. Winters pass by charm. As soon as summer starts it doesn't start after sitting under sunshine for an hour. Engine cranks properly. Battery is at 100% but car just don't want to start as if some sensor is stopping it. Got it checked from dealership, several mechanics, by obd. No one is able to diagnose. A GENUINEEEEEEEEEE ISSUE I let it cool by opening all windows for about half an hour to get it started. Anyone have any clue?
column2: Your car has a bcm (body control module) that handles a lot of functions including remote lock and also engine start. Either your tracking co. Have installed garbage equipment or your factory bcm is faulty. Has someone tried to check the alternator by disconnecting the battery? Or has it suffered a really worn out battery?

column2: @xulfiqar Dealership & random electricians. Car have tracker. And the most important point. Car takes too much time to unlock from remote. Like good few seconds. Don't respond swiftly as normal when this sunshine thing happen. Sometimes i have to unlock it with a key as well. Where should i get it checked?

column1: Hi Users! So I took my Honda City 2015 to Honda Margalla. The car was initially tripping the AC after speed was 100kph, and this only happened once the car was in motion for 1-1.5 hour. The AC will then come back on with a hissing sound if I reduced the car to 70 80 kph and will not go off till I crossed 100 105 once more. This went on 2-3 trips on motorway. Then on one such ride the car started flashing overheating at 120+ initially which would go away if speed reduced. I checked, radiator coolant was 100% and both fans were working. Also, the AC tripping issue persisted. With this issue, I took it to HM. There was no error on the computer attached. They said they will first flush the radiator for overheat issue. They did and said the diagnostic showed no errors, and said should not heat up. (I believe this was not needed now, but at that time I consented). Then they told me (showed me) that the car only had 115 gm of gas, and topped it up. AC was fine (barring the trip thing imo) earlier but now after refilling gas it is super chill. Like ice cold chill. Here is a copy of my bill 18.5K basically. What do you think? How much/ what did I gain/lose from taking it to Honda 2S.
column2: That location is close to Dani's workshop. Next time, you can collect quotes from Dani or Raja Aata bhai and save them.

column2: Ac gas charging is listed 22rs per gram. Which is justified as honeywell USA is also 22rs per gram at our workshop. But mentioning pakwheels would allow you to further get discount on it. However Radiator wash is something not justified and I don't believe any such phenomenon of Radiator wash. And this was not required because ac compressor has heat sensor In it and once not tripped it pops up the light aswell. So only refrigerant top up would have fixed your issue... The dealership has this habit of replacing everything without identification of the root cause of the problem. However what's done is done now.

column1: Hi Users! So I took my Honda City 2015 to Honda Margalla. The car was initially tripping the AC after speed was 100kph, and this only happened once the car was in motion for 1-1.5 hour. The AC will then come back on with a hissing sound if I reduced the car to 70 80 kph and will not go off till I crossed 100 105 once more. This went on 2-3 trips on motorway. Then on one such ride the car started flashing overheating at 120+ initially which would go away if speed reduced. I checked, radiator coolant was 100% and both fans were working. Also, the AC tripping issue persisted. With this issue, I took it to HM. There was no error on the computer attached. They said they will first flush the radiator for overheat issue. They did and said the diagnostic showed no errors, and said should not heat up. (I believe this was not needed now, but at that time I consented). Then they told me (showed me) that the car only had 115 gm of gas, and topped it up. AC was fine (barring the trip thing imo) earlier but now after refilling gas it is super chill. Like ice cold chill. Here is a copy of my bill 18.5K basically. What do you think? How much/ what did I gain/lose from taking it to Honda 2S.
column2: Is there any pop-up notification appearing on the cell phone?

column2: A/C gas charging amount is almost okay +/- .. what did they flush the radiator with is another story.. otherwise radiator service costs somewhere around 1500- 2000 rupees , but since they flushed it with something maybe that's why they charged 10500 .. A/C behaves abnormally due to over or underfilled gas, so that's correct when they told you they'll top up the gas... now check for overheat issues, if that's also resolved.. i think you dodged hitting a big hard rock that they didn't tell you since your car overheated you need to replace head gasket : )

column1: So this is my final build with everything cleaned up and I have also made a new subwoofer enclosure specifically tuned for this subwoofer. Once I receive the city A pillars cover, I will fiberglass the tweeter pods so as not to damage the original A pillar covers. I want to express my gratitude to Sherry bhai and Mustafa bhai for their help. The system sounds incredibly musical and the bass hits impressively low down to 19Hz. I am really pleased with my current build and now I can start planning for the next and bigger project. InshaAllah. -  - Here are the components I used: - - Head Unit: Pioneer DMH-ZS8250BT - - Front Stage: Focal K2 Power 165K2P - - Rear Stage: JL Audio C5-650XO - - Subwoofer: Phase Linear Aliante 12 Si in a ported enclosure tuned at 18Hz - - Speaker Amplifier: Rainbow Germanium Four - - Subwoofer Monoblock Amplifier: JL Audio XD600/1v2 - - Main Power and Ground wire: DB Link Maxkore MX0ANL 0 gauge - - Amplifier Power and Ground: Kicker 4 gauge Silver Tinned OFC x1 and Alpine 4 gauge OFC x3 - - Speaker wire: 14 gauge OFC - - Subwoofer wire: Oehlbach SP15 OFC - - RCA Cable: Audio Technica AT-EA 1000 and other Audio Technica RCAs - - Fuse and Ground Distribution: Audison Connections Distribution Block SFD 41C
column2: The forever sexy 6K2P Midbass drivers running off the Germanium Four

column1: I have one customer in KSA. column2: Yes, they already have concerned certification bodies but for this work, they hired a Pakistani consultant since last 23 years who was based in Karachi. Now they have opened new setup and coincidentally, that Pakistani Consultant has moved to Australia, his team working Behined are not doing satisfactory job so they are looking to hire other professionals. Professionals in KSA are charging sky rocket high plus work level is also different

column1: I have one customer in KSA. They need API certification of their products as they produce engine oil and Diesel engine oil so can anyone guide what is the pre-requisites and which certification bodies in Pakistan have the ability to test and certify those products. Which consultants can assist in getting those products certified? @Storm @hanifbhatti @capsat
column2: KSA being largest oil producer is looking for certification partners in Pakistan ?? Are you sure sir ?? The crude produced by KSA & in GCC is transported to 22 refineries & blending facilities across Asia Africa & Eastern Europe. In Arabian Gulf only Qatar has the largest facility for refining & blending fuels / oil across GCC. Every country which has blending / refinery facility have SAE & API regional offices. Refineries & Blending facilities have licensed lab setups for compliance to respective standards. Please do recheck from your customer if he is serious or was cutting prank with you. Please check from PARCO / TOTAL for their lab setup they may be able to help you.

column1: I got brand new leaf springs, bushings and struts for my vehicle a little while ago, and they've developed a layer of oxidation very quickly, beginning to resemble the worn out, broken springs they replaced. Recently, I've started hearing some prominent squeaking from the rear when going over speed bumps. What's the best way to preserve leaf springs and extend their life? I found a bottle of graphite oil and thought about using a brush to apply it generously to the leaves all the way up until the bushings.

column1: AOA. Hope all good. Today ive started this long awaited n very much sorted after DIY which is more comprehensive than any thread/website available globally for the installation of Cruise Control in the 8th Gen Civic33 aka REBORN I can proudly say that Project ' CRUISEMATEC' was a total success. It took me over a year's research,endless hours of web browsing using my phone with GPRS as i had no DSL connection,family's n colleague's annoyance as i was always(n still) glued to the tiny screen of my Nokia phone, working at nite at the cost of my sleep, sleepless nights thinking ways n means to get it to work, risking ECU of my Civic,busting the clockspring, working during the heat of May n Jun without electricity in my garage(to avoid kids interference etc) n what not n what not....... heres my story........ column1: If a car is not being used for several months, then how many days should I wait before starting it, and for how long should I keep it running so that the battery doesn't die? This question is for a 1.3 Baleno with a 50Ah maintenance-free battery (new). The car only has a central locking system installed, with no tracker, amplifier, woofer, etc. Please suggest anything but removing the battery terminals.
column2: You can start it once a week. But keep it running for 5-10 mins (depending on the weather). It will charge your battery, and heat up the oil to optimum temperature.

column2: basic;4176931: Still keeping that system in the cupboard cause whenever i put the bike on side stand some one pulled the clutch and there goes the cable (broke from the lever side) so have to remove the system Yes thats a problem in Pakistan - someone from nowhere will start fiddling with the bike - no matter if its theirs or not. A good freind of mine had a similar one like yours except his was black with red stripes. He was a crazy person like me so to tackle this problem of broken clutch cable he made the primary cable wire longer and had a split metal spacer bush that was attached to his keychain, he would insert the thing between the lever adjuster and cable body to make the cable taught. So it worked perfectly, When removed the lever went completely dead from the slack of the cable because the inner wire was too long - he never had broken clutch cables after that. I also did some strange stuff - like make a clevis for the kickstand for my yamaha, that clevis actually held the spring to the stand but was bolted aft of the axle point of the stand, this way when the stand was unloaded - one touch from your foot would send the stand home to folded position. The service table was a "takht" on which a rug and "gaao takiya" is placed in old homes - in this case it held up bikes on top and had tool drawers under it. While I could sit on a chair to repair them.

column2: The kick stand cable mechanism is supposed to have a tension spring and so should the cable sheath insert point near the clutch worm drive, I added this to a lot of bikes, Its pretty simple - the cable inner wire runs through the spring after the boss that holds the cable in position which makes sure the cable never hangs on any position and the lever always feels perfect. The usual complaint of the Kawasaki owners was the clutch feeling limp if the twin cable setup was used. For some reason these two simple springs were ommited - I dont know why.

column2: I hope you dont mind - I painted a couple of lines on one of your originals - to show you the cable spring  your idea is really good. Ducati at one time had such a setup but its pretty clever, The arm that would kick the stand upwards was made such that it only contacted the stand once the bike was upright and the stand unloaded - with bike on stand position the arm would not contact the stand and just swing past the pin of the stand. This ensured your cable never broke. The problem with this setup was that if the system malfunctioned you could end up with a stuck stand and Ducati bikes which had this did not have the service stand (double stand)

column1: My car was having a misfire issue when it was cold started in mornings, but it would be fine after a hard rev, it would smoke for a few seconds and then the engine would smooth out. The plugs were getting shorted due to oil leakage. So it was time to replace the valve seals. The engine is a G13BA in my 97 margalla, which has 320,000 km on the Odometer
column2: Engine looks like its being cleaned of varnish build up too. And, its a pretty decent job you guys did.

column1: My car was having a misfire issue when it was cold started in mornings, but it would be fine after a hard rev, it would smoke for a few seconds and then the engine would smooth out. The plugs were getting shorted due to oil leakage. So it was time to replace the valve seals. The engine is a G13BA in my 97 margalla, which has 320,000 km on the Odometer
column2: On 4 cyl engine, Cyl 1 and 4 and 2 and 3 are companions at crankshaft. So when you rotate to bdc cyl1 and 4 are at bdc, rope was fed into cylinders 1 and 4 and then rotated to tdc. This squeezes the rope into the combustion chambers and will prevent the valves from dropping when the collets are removed.

There is another Total Pump near Honda Gateway (Multan Road) which is also good. Total Pump on Canal Bank Road near Rainbow Cash and Carry is also ok. Attock pump near Fazil Masjid on Canal Road should be avoided.

column1: I own a honda civic 2019, the car door speakers work just fine when the sub and amp are not attached but when i plug them in, it feels like all the sound is coming from sub and car door speakers are barely working. What is the solution to this without incurring additional cost? Is there a way around this issue?
column2: Did your guy splice the subwoofer into the speakers?

column1: I own a honda civic 2019, the car door speakers work just fine when the sub and amp are not attached but when i plug them in, it feels like all the sound is coming from sub and car door speakers are barely working. What is the solution to this without incurring additional cost? Is there a way around this issue?
column2: The speaker wires originate from the head unit in the dash, no need to even do anything in the door.

column1: I own a honda civic 2019, the car door speakers work just fine when the sub and amp are not attached but when i plug them in, it feels like all the sound is coming from sub and car door speakers are barely working. What is the solution to this without incurring additional cost? Is there a way around this issue?
column2: Do you know what amp you are running? What sub? And are the speakers wired to the amp or running directly from the headunit? Need to see pics of the setup and the wiring to tell you what's wrong. Could be a number of reasons including bad wiring configuration

column1: I own a honda civic 2019, the car door speakers work just fine when the sub and amp are not attached but when i plug them in, it feels like all the sound is coming from sub and car door speakers are barely working. What is the solution to this without incurring additional cost? Is there a way around this issue?
column2: Please post a pic of the other side of the amp too. Where the speaker terminals are What city are you living in? So what i assume is that you are running rhe speakers from the stock unit and the sub is powered from the amp because that's what I see in the pic, just the sub wire and 1 pair of rca's which would be for the sub I'm also sure your installer has cranked that gain knob to get as much bass from that sub. That's the reason the sub bass drowns your speakers

column1: I own a honda civic 2019, the car door speakers work just fine when the sub and amp are not attached but when i plug them in, it feels like all the sound is coming from sub and car door speakers are barely working. What is the solution to this without incurring additional cost? Is there a way around this issue?
column2: Please head over to soundvalley in pindi saddar. Talk to the owner Shehryar that I (Mustafa) sent you. He'll tune the setup for you. The problem is, you're running the speakers from the stock headunit. If you had upgraded front speakers, you could have easily connected those to the amp too and that way, atleast the front stage would have matched the sub and you wouldn't feel the mids and highs getting drowned by the sub. The built in amps in stock headunits are not really that competent and factory speakers are pretty much useless when you push them since they're made of really thin flimsy paper with miniature sized magnets He'll also do the sound deadening for you. I'd suggest you install the Caliber sheets which cost around 2500 each. 1 sheet just for the trunk lid is more than enough but you can go with 2 if you really want to isolate it, including the black inner padding

column1: Okay, so I have been looking for information regarding Genuine Toyota Oil Filters, specifically for 1NZ-FE engine. There are two variants: Part No. 90915-10003 Made in Japan (costs 800 Rupees from genuine part dealers/about 1200 from Toyota 3S) This is the same part no. as Toyota catalog for Axio Part No. 90915-YZZE1 Made in Thailand (costs about 400 Rupees from genuine part dealers)  I have mostly seen Thailand made oil filters in oil change shops. They give option of Leppon filter but I was not given an option of Japanese Toyota oil filter. The main difference between the two seems to be the element inside, pressure plate and relief valve. Thai made is cheaper, probably because it is sort of a paper? and I suspect it will be prone to holes. I intend to dissect the oil filter once I go for next oil change to see what has happened to it. I am really interested in knowing the exact technical difference between the two. Whether it is safe to use the cheap Thai made oil filter, still a Toyota product for 5000 km interval. Other things like micron rating, by-pass valve setting, flow rate etc. of the two. So far I have only found one website, in Russian which has compared oil filters of different brands. The pictures attached here are all taken from the same website: Link-1212 Link-281 From Google's translation of the site, I understand that the Thai filter's pressure plate also serves as the relief valve i.e. no dedicated relief valve. (This obviously is another cost saving step) While on Japanese, the pressure plate is separate and relief valve is embedded within the filter element. Can someone please tell me the pros/cons of pressure plate serving as a relief valve as well? Here's what I am talking about, Japanese (pressure plate is to the right of filter, relief valve is embedded on top of the filter element):  Thai (nothing in the filter element, the pressure plate is also relief valve):  and some more detailed images  MADE IN JAPAN    Close up of the filter element. Relief valve can be clearly seen there, the coil thing.  MADE IN THAILAND  Nothing embedded in filter media. Pressure plate to the right also serves as relief valve   Close up of the filter element  Thank you for reading the topic. Looking forward to gain knowledge about this from everyone who can participate.
column2: that fibrous looking filter (japanse) is specified for sludge prone engines like the 1MZFE etc, It has a higher bypass pressure too, The other paper type is specified for all general purpose. For easy understanding the japanese filter will trap more particulate but fill up quick and then flush the particulate in the engine if the bypass opens, hence use a low viscosity high detergent oil. The other ZZ part number filter is like a regular filter, it has a bypass too, the bottom assembly holds a coil spring which unloads the element and causes the oil to short circuit out of the casing (bypass) There is another filter that comes in new toyota engines only, it has a very fine media in it I have not been able to buy it as spare part. The closest filter to it is this japanese one. Now go buy a leppon filter and cut it open, you will have your quality test.

column2: fine media filters running in dirty engines will choke quicker than coarse media ones. meaning they will fill up faster, when filled up the bypass valve will open up as more pressure is exerted on it. If you use a nice synth oil like Helix Ultra 5w30 in your engine, it will scrub it clean and also stay in a thinner state at normal temperature. It wont lift the bypass that easily.

column2: It will be pretty hard to reuse the bypass valve of the fine media filter as you have to destroy the cartridge to remove it, the other paper media filter has it as a separate part and can be reused, but the media itself needs to be of exact shape and size. If you notice the original toyota filter does not employ full end caps on the media barrel and the bypass sits under leaf spring pressure against the canister. You would need to make an exact copy of that - which is pretty hard to do commercially if you wish to sell it as fake product in wholesale. You can shine a light to see the bypass valve and deduce its construction if its higher quality or not.

column1: Dear experts. I am facing a a problem in the car that the operating temperature is not maintained properly. Thermostat is there and although the temperature needle starts moving up but when driving continuously the needle doesn't reach the middle (at optimum operating temperature). Needle even drops near to Cold mark when driving at high speeds on highways. The only problem which comes to mind is that thermostat is not closing properly but I removed the thermostat and installed a new Japanese one and still the issue is same. Also I checked both thermostats but placing them in hot water and saw both are working fine (opening and closing). Why the car is not able to maintain the optimum temperature? Due to this heater is also not working good. There is no overheating or coolant reduction issue otherwise.

column2: you may need a different thermostat valve as in Suzuki Bolan - There is a likely chance that cluster gauge has developed some corrosion. 1988-1993 Swift was notorious for such error. 2 / 3 / 4/ 6 channel radiator will not make any difference. The coolant capacity of the engine channels remain unchanged. Thermostat will open / close only at the specific temperature. @Xulfiqar @VCheng @rajaatta @dani_kk @SER_GTR @nomi01 @hassan1991 @babarhyd please correct me if am wrong

column2: Gents, do I understand correctly that even if a radiator with 2, 4, 6, or 8 channels and high coolant capacity is installed, the engine with a thermostat will still operate in the same way? For example, the valve will open at 88/92°C and the automatic fan will switch on/off at 98/93°C. I tried explaining this using a domestic geyser as an analogy in a local language, but I was unsuccessful. No matter how large the geyser is, the temperature setting of the gas burner thermostat is what determines how hot the water will be. As long as the gas supply to the burner is sufficient, it won't make any difference. Even if the burner runs for a longer period, it will consume more gas.

column2: The radiator design determines its maximum heat dissipation capacity. The thermostat determines how much of that capacity to use at any given time. The sensor and its wiring determine what is displayed on the instrument cluster.

column1: Few days ago one of my car's wiper rubber got demaged so decided to change it.went to market just to find that they are not available,shopkeepr said change only the rubber rest of things are gud.So i did that.But during yesterday's rain i observed that the wipers are nto working properly i mean there is sound coming when they move.Plus water is starting to stay on wind screen within wiper's cleaning range. So was wondering where to get gud wipers or their rubber?? metro has 'BOSCH' wipers donno if they are orginal's or fake.Plus fitting them on my car could be an issue.plz anyone has the solution for this??
column2: if you soooooooo finicky - treat your glass with rain-x I bought a bottle from a car acessory shop - and applied it to the windshield, it beads the water off the windshield - and you dont have to use wipers that much. For blades - you can buy inserts easily - but if you or someone else have tampered with the metal spine of the blade - it will be useless, usually I see the hawkers bend the spine out of shape or twist the wiper arm for some reason, The best wipe action comes from the blade pressed down square from the centre and the blade should not be floppy on the arm - the wiper will chatter on the screen if its floppy - you can insert very thin plastic spacers on the sides of the clips of the blade piece to prevent chattering. I buy genuine heavy metal wiper blades from the shersha junkyard and only replace the rubber pieces if necessary, work like a charm

column2: Montgomery Road is a famous thoroughfare located in Lahore, Pakistan. It is named after General Sir Robert Montgomery, who served as the Lieutenant-Governor of Punjab during British rule. The road stretches from the Punjab Assembly Building to the Canal Bridge, passing through various prominent neighborhoods and commercial areas. It is a bustling hub of activity with shops, restaurants, and businesses lining the street. Montgomery Road is well-known for its vibrant atmosphere and is a popular destination for locals and tourists alike.

column2: Well when one buys new car he tends to spend more. I think it was the first summer of my car (2005) when I noticed that the driver side wiper blade was leaving a droplets stream. Fearing it might sandblast my car's new windscreen, I immediately went to Toyota Capital and got new rubbers (the metal part of the previous ones was inserted in them). Since then, almost five and half years, those rubbers are doing a very fine job. Then they cost 800 rupees. I still have the stock rubbers as spare in the car in case needed in emergency. So yes, buy from 3S they are expensive but last much much longer than the ones we buy from open market.

In Sha Allah, Did a few tweaks, and researched the earlier experiments done on this setup before by senior members here. Could use all the input i could get; in order to keep it a fun, daily driven, but a fine track car on the weekends as well. Sheryar. @ 4K Garage 03214707737
column2: Wailakum Assalam That's the first thing you should invest on either a piggyback or a standalone. Wideband is useless without it. Retune the fuel and ignition maps. Take the vvtli time down to 5k. Port the head and intake manifolds. Install aftermarket valve springs. 2zzge oil pump is not happy with frequent high reving upgrade that. See how much it can rev being in powerband. Next your cams will be the restriction. If you face pre-detonation switch to one step colder plugs. You can go for shorter final drive if you increase the rev limit. You are making a n/a engine no need to upgrade bottom end, it's ready light and forged.

column2: As i said those things aren't helping you get anything without a tune specially headers. 165's are soo tiny. You would be spinning till 100. N/a engine doesn't need high fuel pressure. 255lph would be enough, also the size of hoses matter. Clutches are rated on torque. 1.8cc doesn't got much at low end. He's talking about harmonic damper. An aftermarket one will help you rev high quickly as it light. Reduce rotational mass. Nope you need to buy a spare engine for internals. Lotus came with stock super charged 2zzge running on 7psi. Makes ~260hp. Rods of 2zzge are beefy. Do upgrade the piston rings. Contact saajid in bilal gunj for aftermarket clutch and flywheel.

column1: I recently swapped Diesel engine of indus Corolla with a petrol auto transmission engine of 94 Corolla I am very sad about the mileage it’s giving me Around 7km/l urban driving with AC I need help or referral to an actual mechanic who can fix this problem. Also, I feel the engine is reving too much on the initial 20km/hr speed I’m not sure I am making sense but any help will be appreciated I’m based in Gulshan karachi.
column2: Is the ecu fully wired up? Each and every wire connected like it should?

column1: I recently swapped Diesel engine of indus Corolla with a petrol auto transmission engine of 94 Corolla I am very sad about the mileage it’s giving me Around 7km/l urban driving with AC I need help or referral to an actual mechanic who can fix this problem. Also, I feel the engine is reving too much on the initial 20km/hr speed I’m not sure I am making sense but any help will be appreciated I’m based in Gulshan karachi.
column2: sir you may take the vehicle to irshad ahmed at jamil autos 0300 223 7538. request him to perform compression test dry & wet (both), at all 4 cylinders before any other diagnostics. if the compression values are below 160 each cylinder wet & dry combined. The engine need overhaul. if values get better at wet test most likely the valves are leaking and need work. as there are several members who do not recommend swaps from yards instead they suggest overhauling engine be it a diesel or petrol. scrapyard engines are very high value bet with 70% poor and 30% reasonable performance upon swap.

column1: Calling all Mitsubishi Mirage owners and tech-wizards on Pakwheels. I need to change CVT fluid for my Mirage 2013 and unfortunately Mitsubishi Mirage Genuine CVTF-J4 is not available in Pakistan. Moreover it seems difficult to import. Can someone kindly guide me what to do? Most people suggest I should only replace genuine Mitsubishi CVTF-J4. Unfortunately the specs of CVTF-J4 are not available - so that I can compare and find anything close to it. If any existing Mirage owners in Pakistan have overcome this issue OR if Mr. Xulfi has a solution - I will apprecaite the advice. Thank you and best wishes Furqan
column2: Furqan.ahmed.pak: Mitsubishi Mirage Genuine CVTF-J4 is not available in Pakistan. If the genuine or original equipment manufacturer (OEM) CVTF is not available, then please refer to my previous post in another thread.  -  - Anon3595377: CVT Oil [images]. I purchased this oil from Pakistan Oil Store in Lahore for Rs. 3150 for a 4L pack in December 2018. It fully meets the requirements of Toyota CVT transmission oil for my vehicle. When I go for regular preventive maintenance, I will also change the CVT oil.  -  - Furqan.ahmed.pak: Can someone kindly guide me on what to do? If you look at the pictures, you will see that this CVTF also meets the criteria (CVTF-J4) set by Mitsubishi. In my opinion, you can use it. Genuine or OEM Toyota CVTF-TC and CVTF-FE are available in the market, but I still chose this oil for my Vitz. Alhamdulillah, it is working perfectly fine. I hope this helps. Thank you.

If any existing Mirage owners in Pakistan have overcome this issue OR if Mr. Xulfi has a solution - I will apprecaite the advice. Thank you and best wishes Furqan
column2: Mirage employs the Nissan Jatco JF015 transmission, which can safely use either Nissan NS3 or J4 fluids as they have the same specifications. Other brands like Liqui Moly may not be compatible in terms of viscosity. You can refer to this link (www.pakwheels.com/forums/t/toyota-altis-grande-cvt-fluid-change-transmission-code-k313/995963/206) for a comparison. I have a few cans of NS3 fluid and a new gasket seal available if anyone is interested. Please inform me if you need them.

column1: I own a 2017 Civic Turbo with OEM dual screens. The secondary screen (Console Screen) is linked to the primary screen. This means any action performed on the secondary screen reflects on the primary screen, and vice versa. Unfortunately, the primary screen, a Techno model, runs on an outdated Android version that cannot be updated, preventing the installation of applications. Moreover, it frequently experiences issues such as system freezes. Due to these problems, I intend to replace the primary unit with a new Android panel. However, after consulting several experts in Android systems, they have all expressed concerns that replacing the primary screen might compromise the functionality of the secondary screen. I am seeking advice on whether a solution allows me to replace the primary screen without compromising the secondary screen.
column2: A few members have changed to pioneer units that have android auto/carplay and running the secondary screen off it and everything works perfectly

column1: Hello, using an 82 degrees Celsius thermostat instead of an 80 degrees Celsius thermostat in a car can have both advantages and disadvantages. -  - Advantages: - 1. Improved Engine Performance: A slightly higher temperature thermostat can help in achieving better engine performance as it allows the engine to warm up faster and reach its optimal operating temperature. -  - 2. Improved Fuel Efficiency: When the engine reaches its optimal temperature quickly, it can operate more efficiently, resulting in better fuel economy. -  - 3. Reduced Emissions: With a higher temperature thermostat, the engine can reach its operating temperature faster, which can lead to reduced emissions as the engine operates more efficiently. -  - Disadvantages: - 1. Potential Overheating: One of the main risks of using a higher temperature thermostat is the possibility of overheating. If the cooling system in the car is not able to handle the higher operating temperature, it could lead to engine overheating and potential damage. -  - 2. Increased Wear and Tear: Operating at a higher temperature for prolonged periods may result in increased wear and tear on engine components such as gaskets, seals, and other parts, potentially reducing their lifespan. -  - 3. Limited Cooling System Capacity: The cooling system of a car is designed to dissipate heat generated by the engine based on its specific operating temperature. Switching to a higher temperature thermostat might exceed the cooling system's capacity, resulting in inadequate cooling and potential overheating. -  - It's important to note that any modifications to the thermostat or cooling system should be done carefully, considering the car's specific requirements and manufacturer's recommendations. It is advisable to consult with a professional mechanic or automobile expert before making such modifications.
column2: Wailaikum Assalam Rating written on the thermostat is the opening temperature of it. 82* means it will start opening after 2 more degrees then 80*. Thermostat takes time to fully open up. Engine's temperature will also stay above then 82* while cruising, which should be above then 80* or maybe 80*. In short engine will run 2 degree hotter in all situations. Oem systems are balanced. .

Please check the specs in this link. https://www.jlaudio.com/products/jx500-1d-car-audio-jx-amplifiers-9940013 Asking pkr 37,500 (negotiable). It will cost you way more if you import it from anywhere. The amp is located in Gulistan e Jauhar Khi. Interested buyers can msg me and I will pass on my brother's contact then. Thanks
column2: Pioneer, Kicker, MTX, and Alpine are not unknown. Or are they? By the way, your JL is the best. Stay happy, dear.

column2: Buddy! The argument is not about the what's good and what's not. I can give you a really good example for your initial response. For e.g, a Camry or Accord makes 300hp and cost $30k but a Bmw or Benz making some power cost $10 to 15k more. Would you say the same thing that why should I buy a German car for more when Japanese makes the same power? No. Doesn't mean that Camry or Accord is bad but it''s in a different class. Same goes for anything. I hope you'll understand Btw, I'm asking way less what this amp cost new in usd and still negotiable. You know it will cost twice what I'm asking if gets imported by through local website or a dealer.

column1: Hi guys, So I am looking for someone in lahore who could tune my dsp. I have gone way over my budget to get a separate RTA setup for this. Please provide contacts

Stj174, roms, docshaggy, yawar538, cheetah etc are a few members from lahore who had excellent sq setups that were running active and tuned to perfection. You can find their numbers on their for sale threads. Stj174 (nauman bhai's) setup was insane to say the least

column1: Hi guys, So I am looking for someone in lahore who could tune my dsp. I have gone way over my budget to get a separate RTA setup for this. Please provide contacts
column2: What do you need done ? Setting gains is pretty straight forward - rest is upto you tune it according to your own ears.

column1: The turbo on my Suzuki Jimny seems to be making chirping, whistling noises at the beginning of its boost range, at around 0 - 2 psi. It's an IHI RHB31 turbo with a VZ9 housing. It does not make any noise apart from the normal spooling sound after 2 psi, develops 10psi under WOT, 7-9psi under moderate to heavy load. It behaves completely normally otherwise. I have a BOV installed instead of a diverter/recirc valve. I suspect it might be a gasket seal failure on either the intake or exhaust side of the compressor, vibrating and causing it to behave like a reed. Or is my turbo close to failure?
column2: it could very well be a gasket failure on the exhaust side of things specially if the sound is shrill and loud.

column1: HI, i have an Alto 2017 Japanese variant currently i am facing a issue after removing lithium ion battery for interior cleaning.then ECO mode unable to work.A button just going to blink on speedometer.So please suggest how can it fix this issue. Thanks
column2: Did you plug it back correctly. Remove the main battery terminal for 2-3 minutes and connect it again, it will reset the ECU and uske baad bhi na chala then maybe you damaged something while removing it.

column1: HI, i have an Alto 2017 Japanese variant currently i am facing a issue after removing lithium ion battery for interior cleaning.then ECO mode unable to work.A button just going to blink on speedometer.So please suggest how can it fix this issue. Thanks
column2: there must be a flip switch over the battery casing locate that and try to reset. in all hybrid cars so far i have seen there is a circuit breaker switch.
