This issue can happen with Suzuki AGS as well, but Suzuki vehicles don't show any heat up indicator in the dashboard cluster. You can avoid this issue by adjusting your driving technique, specially in stop and go traffic. Avoid frequent accelerations and let the distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you increase. This should be done to give the transmission a chance to fully release the clutch. Apart from that, it's better to use manual/sports mode in such situations to avoid frequent changing of gears in stop and go traffic. If you don't use manual mode, the computer will not shift to lower gear and tries to pick speed by slipping the clutch. 5: AGS and DCT are jerky Both AGS and DCT jerk in some driving situations, especially in low gears when you accelerate. It's more noticeable in slow moving traffic where you use brakes/accelerate frequently and specially with hard acceleration. This could be controlled with driving behavior as explained in point 4 above. Using manual mode and light acceleration reduce these jerks and when done properly could be eliminated. Remember, if the gear oil is cold, the jerk will stay no matter how you drive. It goes away once the gear oil warms up and with correct driving techniques. 6: CVT delay in initial acceleration When people move from any other transmission to a CVT based vehicle for the first time, they don't like the initial acceleration of the vehicle. When you press the accelerator, the actual acceleration starts with slight delay. This is known as the rubber band effect. Many manufacturers have fine-tuned their transmissions to reduce this as much as possible. So it depends how much rubber band effect you face based on the vehicle you drive. Some have negligible for a common man, and some have a lot. 7: CVT don't climb hills with ease There are a lot of complaints of fully loaded CVT vehicles not being able to climb very steep hills like Babusar Top in the Kaghan Valley. I remember one owner reported he had a hard time climbing a steep incline in the basement parking of some mall. CVT is not the favorite transmission for people who drive a lot in hilly areas. Conclusion All of these issues are not explained to fear you or the new car buyers. The point is to help you make an informed decision and choose the right transmission by knowing the common issues and maintenance and replacement (in case of failure) cost in advance, or leave these transmissions in the first place if you don’t want to spend hefty money on them. Many people sacrifice the reliability, maintenance cost, fuel economy, less power (transmission power losses) for the ease of driving these transmissions provide when compared to manuals. It all comes down to personal preference.
column2: The carburetor engine is indifferent. It continues to receive fuel even when idle.

column1: Hello everyone I need help in planning stuff for a SQ build, on a fairly flexible budget. I would like to call myself an audiophile as I am looking for quality rather than volume. Depth and separation of instruments is what I cherish while listening to music. What I need is information on what to buy and where to buy it in Lahore. I have been going through the forums here and I am open to order stuff online as long as the seller is trustworthy. I am big on an informed purchase and would really appreciate your help. Head Unit Pioneer DEH8850MP The prices for headunits are sky high these days and I plan to scavenge as much use out of this as possible. This head unit is pretty old and has been collecting dust for a lot of years. This was used in my Cultus back in 2014. It has all the SQ stuff which I need, DSP, crossovers, auto time alignment. I think I may be able to use it in an active setup. Through my research I have realised this used to be a pretty good back in 2000s. The only problem I have with it are that it is a single DIN unit and doesn't have bluetooth. But I can make do with using an USC-C DAC dongle. Currently my car has a cheap chinese head unit which costed like 5-6k a year ago. Front stage: I have spent the past week researching about different component speakers and shortlisted a few of them based on availability and budget. But now I have become a bit overwhelmed with information and need to know of any alternates from Hertz, Focal, Massive etc JBL GTO 609C Infinity Reference 6530 Sub stage: For this I just want a decent subwoofer, budget isn't very passionate about this. I am looking for a single subwoofer in a sealed enclosure Amplifier: Currently I have this stuff, note that this stuff is pretty old and has been lying around since late 2000s only to be used in my Cultus back in 2014 for a while before it was sold off: Boschmann PCH-6882EX Specs @ https://store9658340.ecwid.com/Boschmann-PCH-6882EX-p2681999571 JVC AX5700 Specs @ https://support.jvc.com/consumer/product.jsp?modelId=MODL027604&page=3&lang=es Sound treatment: I have treated the front doors and the rear wheel arches and trunk with Orientech 2mm sheets.
column2: Your initial choice of the 609c and infinity 6530 are more than good enough. I'd go with the 6530 if the price differance isn't much Since you're only running front stage and a sub ( my 07 didn't have space for rear speakers in the doors ), best to use a 4 channel amp. There's no need for another 2 channel amp unless you want to run your 2 way comps active Amp prices have sky rocketed too. However, a good 4 channel that is a tad bit under rated and has enough juice to not let you wanting more from your speakers is the pioneer 4704. Sure the 6704 would be an even better choice but thats 30k+ these days. A 4704 will cost you in the ballpark of 24k The jbl cs1214 is a good entry level sub. I have it in sealed box lined with polyfill and it's doing a great job of keeping with my Helix F62c's. It's tight and accurate and a great sub to start with. Offcourse there are better options but I got that for under 20k and I don't regret it A good set of comps will cost you 25-30k A good 4 channel will cost you 25-40k A nice sql sub will cost between 20-25k Pay more and you can get better equipment. It's really upto you. Ask soundvalley in pindi, haroon radio in karachi, soundworks in lahore about products and prices. Lasersound is another shop in lahore too

column1: I got Mitsubishi EK Wagon 660CC 3 speed Auto 2007. 100K driven... My car shakes and vibrate like hell while AC is on. Plus its engine gets switched off while in reverse gear while AC on. I have already changed the mounts, AC belt, auto adjuster, compressor oil, AC gas etc even I have changed the throttle body but all in vain. Some mechanics increase the RMPs but I know that is not the solution. Can any Allah Ka Banda solve my problem? Regards, Junaid
column2: @khuram2703 i have similar issue in my car (Liana). the rpms are not stable and on AC is suddenly shuts off anywhere anytime by dropping rpms. mechanic says the valves are gone as car was run excessively on cng before. do you think my issue is similar to yours?

column2: Brother ! I have an OTTI aka EK Wagon.... same Model....... I have also gone through the teething problem by replacing and rectifying above all things Throttle body service and inspection Scanner no error code... Air valve adjustment. Fuel filter replacement.. Cat Con cleaned... NGK Platinium Alloy Spark plugs installed... Tensioner replaced due to abnormal sound... (Although it has nothing to do with this problem) Tappet valve adjustment carried out, found tight Exh valves and loose intake valves... ...... at last i checked Cylinders compression found to be 140/160 psi which should be 200 to 240 psi. In warm up situation when the AC is switched ON.... that weak engine compression causing RPM drop which also lower down the boost pressure of the brake booster causing brake paddle to become hard and brake less effective....... The solution for us both is engine replacement ....

column2: No, in Liana, it is related to auto valve adjusters (mechanics call them valve tickki). Liana has a VVTi mechanism with auto valve adjustment. column1: I own a 2007 Honda Civic hybrid. It currently has 15-inch rims with 195/65R15 tires. I am considering installing 16-inch rims from a newer Civic model along with 205/55R16 tires. Would this be a wise decision?
column2: You will loose the comfort and the handling will suffer negatively. Tyres will rub the frame on lock to lock turning. Fuel mileage will go down significantly aswell. The suspension is designed for certain type of wheel. 16 inch rim of 8th gen civic is not the same as 10th gen spec wise, then again the suspension is tuned for that wheel. First hand experience.

column2: My experience: - Less comfortable. You'll feel the ups and downs of the plain road more. It is smooth but still you feel more. - Shocks compress too much. You can feel this on uneven roads or while turning. I don't know for now what effect it will have. - Handling a little difficult on above 100. I am not sure if it is related. Handling of this car is not that good anyway. Maybe I am saying this because I am used to hydraulic power steering. I didn't like the handling of electrical steering. - No noticeable difference in fuel economy. Maybe because it is hybrid. - Tyres didn't hit the frame. - Looks beautiful.

column1: Today I changed the front brakepads to my 2010 Corolla Altis 1.8 and sand papered the existing rear brakepads. The brand is ADVICS which is also OEM for Toyota brakepads. It's made in Thailand and I bought it from a well-reputed auto store in Mardan. Car breaking is now perfect (not too hard, not too soft) but as soon as I reached home, I noticed a "Takk Takk" sound when I gently press the brake pad (so gentle press that the brakes don't engage). Otherwise, I don't hear this sound at all when doing normal breaking. I don't know what went wrong!?
column2: If this grease was used to service the brake calipers, they will sieze. You need silicone grease and the little boots that go on the slidepins. Did your mechanic install new anti rattle clips on the pad carrier? or are they missing from your car?

column1: Today I changed the front brakepads to my 2010 Corolla Altis 1.8 and sand papered the existing rear brakepads. The brand is ADVICS which is also OEM for Toyota brakepads. It's made in Thailand and I bought it from a well-reputed auto store in Mardan. Car breaking is now perfect (not too hard, not too soft) but as soon as I reached home, I noticed a "Takk Takk" sound when I gently press the brake pad (so gentle press that the brakes don't engage). Otherwise, I don't hear this sound at all when doing normal breaking. I don't know what went wrong!?
column2: you applied silicone RTV to the brake pad rattle clips? - are you serious now? my man, those clips take a dab of silicone grease, not sealant - and your clips seem like no one has ever bothered to even touch them with anything to clean them up. please remove this sealant from them, clean them with a brush, soap and water and use a wire brush to clean the area where these clips sit, clean till you see shiny metal, then a touch of silicone grease is spread there to prevent rust and the clips seated on top. silicone grease is 100% waterproof.

column2: These clips are sold as part of a kit with aftermarket brake pads but our importer bhai hazraat dont actually buy anything officially but buy auction lots as scrap removal from warehouses. However these clips are available as genuine spare parts from showroom parts counter too. And you only need a drop of the grease, one 85 gram tube will last you a decade or more in private car ownership.

column1: Dear Friends, In your opinion, what are the ways to avoid car body to be rusted specially in rain sessinos. Is there any long term solution of this problem. And if there is some rust on the body, how to clean it and bring the body in the original condition?
column2: to trear the rusted areas ther eare chemical solutions which change the rust into a more solid state and then it can be painted over without the rust coming back in the same area. just remember that rust is like an infection, if you just paint over it, it will not go away. It needs to be removed or treated.

column1: Dear Friends, In your opinion, what are the ways to avoid car body to be rusted specially in rain sessinos. Is there any long term solution of this problem. And if there is some rust on the body, how to clean it and bring the body in the original condition?
column2: rust convertor is your saviour - mix with water and apply let dry - when hard and black paint over it, wont rust for its life. never never never apply engine oil or diesel fuel to the undercarriage if you wish to own the car for more than 2 years

column1: Dear Friends, In your opinion, what are the ways to avoid car body to be rusted specially in rain sessinos. Is there any long term solution of this problem. And if there is some rust on the body, how to clean it and bring the body in the original condition?
column2: the car underbody is coated with a clear wax - oil is absorbed into the wax making it puffy and flaky - which then comes off exposing the bare metal which obviously rusts, if you wont use oil the coating remains intact.. just clean the car with a strong jet of water and then take some quality grade silicone oil and apply it to all rubber bushes with a sponge to make them like new again.. if the coating is compromised you can buy products to repair it - if its missing altogether, you can reapply a 3M rubber undercoating to the car - works beautifully

column1: Dear Friends, In your opinion, what are the ways to avoid car body to be rusted specially in rain sessinos. Is there any long term solution of this problem. And if there is some rust on the body, how to clean it and bring the body in the original condition?
column2: the 3M coating can be found at a paint supply store having 3M dealership - its a spray can and quite heavy too called 3m car undercoating, comes in clear and black finish. As for your margalla - go buy some rust convertor and apply it to the areas - they will turn black or browinish black when dry - it stops rust dead in its tracks - then paint over it (very hard and porous which is good for paint) or if its inside somewhere leave it alone treated.

column1: Can someone please guide me that which sub woofer should i buy pioneer d4 or s4? I need clear bass and beats!
column2: If your amplifier is genuine (Pioneer, Sony, Alpine etc.) and it is at least 2 Ohm stable, you can use D4 in parallel configuration. However, if you are using a Chinese or 12000 watt amplifier, it is recommended to use S4 for maximum bass.

column1: Is there any way to fix cracked taillights
column2: If it is just a cracked then you can apply superglue from the inside of the lense and prevent the cracks from spreading over time. Most light repair shops will have a cost-effective solition bit the best will always be a replacement if the crack is bothering you and/or if it is not watertight anymore.

column1: Is there any way to fix cracked taillights
column2: not all lights have rear cover spare available i got mine repaired and then i wrapped it red. crack / repair almost un noticeable after wrap

column1: Is there any way to fix cracked taillights
column2: Apply elfy on the Crack so water doesnt go in and it stops there. Or else get a new light if insured. Replacement cover looks ok for a week then it fades away looks really bad.

column1: Is there any way to fix cracked taillights
column2: Get a replacement cover (the red plastic part only) , would be available at any light repair shop

column1: Is there any way to fix cracked taillights
column2: Well that's the thing only the plastic cover is cracked, rest of the light if totally fine, so i don't want to change the whole thing...... can't the cover be replaced?

column1: Assalam-o-Alaikum, I have Honda Civic 1999. I recently found out that it doesn't have a catalytic converter. Instead it has two resonators, which are also from Alto VXR with a smaller diameter (as the exhaust mechanic said). What should I do? Should I get these replaced? Should I replace both with resonator or a resonator and a catalytic converter?
column2: Please replace the old parts and install the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) size parts.

column1: Assalam-o-Alaikum, I have Honda Civic 1999. I recently found out that it doesn't have a catalytic converter. Instead it has two resonators, which are also from Alto VXR with a smaller diameter (as the exhaust mechanic said). What should I do? Should I get these replaced? Should I replace both with resonator or a resonator and a catalytic converter?
column2: Your car doesn't not came with o2 2 resonators are not the problem, the diameter of them which restricts the flow. Exhaust has direct effect on the performance of an engine.

column1: Assalam-o-Alaikum, I have Honda Civic 1999. I recently found out that it doesn't have a catalytic converter. Instead it has two resonators, which are also from Alto VXR with a smaller diameter (as the exhaust mechanic said). What should I do? Should I get these replaced? Should I replace both with resonator or a resonator and a catalytic converter?
column2: No don't adjust it with looking at the feedback. For that you need exhaust gas analyser. Change the exhaust to oem. It is not an expensive stuff to do rather then messing with other stuff.

column1: Assalam-o-Alaikum, I have Honda Civic 1999. I recently found out that it doesn't have a catalytic converter. column1: Hi everyone! I just bought a City Aspire 1.5. There' something bugging me a lot. I can't find any option of playing the USB or SD card on the multimedia system screen. My screen looks like this. How do I play the USB or SD card? Help would be much appreciated. Thanks!
column2: I tried running different video formats converted with different parameters like different bit rate, encapsulation etc., but nothing seemed to work. As a DVD runs fine in the OEM Multimedia, I then converted my videos to DVD format i.e., .vob and it worked. I then purchased an SD card, formatted it in FAT32 File System and dumped all .vob files in it. Though, it occupies a lot of space of my card, yet it is working.

column2: Vaqas1;2558650: Ser can you explain what is IG - Wire? I can see all sensors hooked up if i look into engine bay only sensor that is not hooked is the one that is in the Air Cleaner box tht he will fix tomorow alongwith Tachometer. Now about wiring part bcoz I mostly run my car on CNG how can these sensors help? I mean if some sensor isnt working how its gona effect the cng performance? My mechanic unhooked a sensor that is hooked into the area where thermostate valve is he says the car should have raised RPM when he unhooked it so this sensor is not properlly working. I am feeling like an idiot i mean these mechanics dun kno anything about wiring and I also dont have time or enough energy to dig into this thing. So i will need maximum Help from you guys. ig- is ignition coil negative (coil switching) wire, its used ti run rpm - if your electric wala has problems tracing this wire he can also use the igf wire from the ignitor. the ecu looks at all sensors for various inputs - including some load sensors too to stabilise rpms - there is nothing that you disconnect to raise revs - whatever the person was upto, he was fooling you.

column1: Hey guys, I would like to invite all those Starlet Fans out there who has been struggling for the parts availability issues, The only problem is that there isn't one single platform provided, I receive not less than 10 calls a day asking me where to find this and where to find that, Since I have an on going project of starlet and have learned a lot from it I have experienced those major issues quite few times which a new to starlet will face, I would like to bring you all on one page so that we all can share our expertise & services where required, If they can do it out there in the west continents why cant we !!! I have imported few parts and later on I found em here in the local market in a different city, So yes you can save your time by just asking one simple Question WHERE CAN I FIND THIS ??? Happy Driving

column1: I recently restored a Datsun 510 to its former glory. I wanted to put a bigger engine under the hood but was sceptical of the rear end bearing the punishment so i planned on sticking to the engine that was already installed (datsun120y). I got the engine overhauled and replaced everything and anything that i could find in the market. Since i live in Peshawar the availability of parts was near to 10% so it wasnt a very nice job. After the whole car was restored the engine started troubling me and would never drive proper so after being framed on bricks for 3 months i decided to swap the engine. Since the car comes with independent suspension i could not put in a big engine like an sr20 or the engine of my choice 4age, so i planned on bringing it to its BRE specs with not too much and not less. Ive finally installed a Pajero Jr's engine in it 1100cc makes 80 bhp and is pretty much the same spec as the transam winner 510 spec. What do u guys think about my choice and what do u think was a better alternate.. P.s: the car has amazing amounts of torque and drifts really smoothly (which i love)
column2: As for as i think ,u opted for d best available option best of luck for d ride

Please somebody suggest me in terms of fuel consumption and engine's durability as I have heard that IKD engines do not last longer. Thanks in advance!! Petrol variant has less maintenance but too heavy on fuel. 1KZ-TE is better in terms of maintenance as compared to 1KD-FTV. 1KD-FTV is not designed to run on low quality diesel as in Pakistan. Nozzle injectors get damaged soon and are also too costly. it is better to go for 1KZ. As far as petrol and diesel fuel consumption is compared then diesel gives better mileage than petrol. My vote is for 1KZ. Rest you can wait for more experts' opinion. Regards

column1: "Solution for the error ""Please insert correct map disk"" for a Japanese car Toyota ND3A-W54A. The car is from the year 2006 with the platform kiwi and version A24. It is compatible with other systems such as Toyota ND3T-W54, Toyota ND3T-D54, Toyota NDCT-W54E, Toyota NDCN-W54, and Toyota NDCN-D54 from the year 2004. It is also compatible with Toyota ND3T-W55, Toyota NDDA-W55, Toyota NDCN-W55, and Toyota NDCN-D55 from the year 2005. -  - This error occurs when the battery of the car has been disconnected, and the device needs the correct map disk to restore its functionality. To fix this error, follow the steps below: -  - 1. Make a boot CD by downloading the full version of burnware CD burner from the link provided. - 2. Burn the file LOADING.KIWI on a CD-R at the minimum speed. - 3. Download the software for your specific Toyota model (ND3A-W54A, ND3T-W54, ND3T-D54, NDCT-W54E, NDCN-W54, NDCN-D54, ND3T-W55, NDDA-W55, NDCN-W55, NDCN-D55) from the link provided. -  - By following these steps, you will be able to restore the functionality of your Toyota ND3A-W54A car's navigation system."

column1: Hello everyone, does anyone know of a workshop in Islamabad where I can find skilled professionals who are proficient in MIG welding?
column2: MIG welding, also known as Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW), is a form of welding that uses a wire electrode and a shielding gas to create an electric arc between the electrode and the metal being welded. The electrode is fed through a welding gun and the shielding gas, usually a mixture of argon and carbon dioxide, is used to protect the weld from atmospheric contamination. -  - MIG welding is a popular method for joining different types of metals, including steel, stainless steel, and aluminum. It is commonly used in various industries such as automotive, construction, and manufacturing. -  - During the welding process, the electric current passes through the wire electrode and generates heat, which melts the metal and forms a weld pool. The weld pool then solidifies, creating a strong joint between the two pieces of metal. -  - MIG welding offers several advantages, including high welding speeds, ease of use, and the ability to weld in different positions. It also produces clean and smooth welds with minimal splatter or slag, reducing the need for extensive post-weld clean-up. -  - Overall, MIG welding is a versatile and efficient welding technique that is widely used in many applications due to its effectiveness and reliability.

column1: Hello everyone, does anyone know of a workshop in Islamabad where I can find skilled professionals who are proficient in MIG welding?
column2: mig welding is metal inert gas welding.. the filler electrode melts and fill the gap between the metal... however due to the high temperatures the metal oxidises immediately... so to prevent that an inert gas like argon is continuously sprayed on the welded area while welding to prevent any air(oxygen) in that area. metals like aluminium are welded this way.

column1: Hi experts what do u say about comparison between Zic and kixx ?? Which one is better ? Sent from my iPhone using PW Forums
column2: I've used ZIC A+ in all my cars and I'm using Zic - 0w-30 in Vezel. The oils great, its fully synthetic and can go upto whatever car manufacturer recommend. I usually change it at 5k though cuz of bad oil filters. At 3k km i checked oil and it was just a bit more brown then what it came but not black/burnt. I think it can go for 10k. Price is also really less 2800 or something compared to other expensive oils. I used Zic A+ in my APV from 0 km to 175k km and the engine was still just like new. Never used KIXX though. Sent from my ALE-L21 using Tapatalk

column2: huzaifa.haroon;4809044: Use all kind of cleaners , engine flush , injector cleaners , oil and filter change. Btw , if the air filter Assembly was not properly installed then there should be a check light on dash and engine won't rev properly. If the airbox is not seated, no check light will illuminate, it will only illuminate when you have an airleak from the MAF to the throttle (including PCV leaks) The pop he heard was the filter not doing its "arresting" job, it actually prevents backfire when the cams do their "thing"

column2: Error 62 is blower fan motor related. On the heater and if the motor rotates? Most of the time you have to replace the IC (2 black ICs are responsible for blower motor control)

column1: Hello, I have a japanese gas heater. Bought 2 years ago and has been working great till now. Since morning when you switch it on after 15 sec it starts beeping and giving error 12. What could be the reasom? Gas pressure is perfect just like before I am attaching pictures of the heater
column2: Looks like insufficient air flow. Clean the air intake filter, it is usually a grill (jali) on the back. If you use an air blower, make sure you obstruct the axial fan using some screw driver so that it does not rotate fast with air from the blower otherwise you may ruin your fan motor.

column1: Fuels Total Parco offers a variety of top quality fuels on its service stations to suit the needs of every customer and is at the forefront of taking new initiatives in the oil industry. It was the first OMC in Pakistan to launch 90RON unleaded petrol under the brand name of Hi-Super without any additional cost to the customer. It was also a pioneer in the concept of creating mobile filling stations to effectively cater to the needs of far flung rural areas by providing them with quality Diesel at their doorstep. In keeping with the current trends Total Parco has the highest percentage of retail stations that offer CNG.

column1: i need to adjust the throttle position sensor for my baleno, i need help regarding that ...specially from Xulfiqar. first i wanna share what i know about throttle position sensor....primarily it send ECU about the throttle position, how much is it open or closed... regarding its adjustment, i know that at desired RPM at idle ( after warm up ) it has to send voltage signal in a particular range.... i need to know that range and also need to know the pins on which i will connect a multimeter or volt meter to calibrate it correctly.... as per my understanding, if TPS is not calibrated correctly the car hesitates during acceleration.. the engine in question is SUZUKI G16B and it has throttle position sensor attached at back of throttle body and also can i clean it with a carburator cleaner before adjusting.... looking for response from brother Xulfiqar for a quick DIY.....
column2: Is your car running on Compressed Natural Gas (CNG)?

column1: i need to adjust the throttle position sensor for my baleno, i need help regarding that ...specially from Xulfiqar. first i wanna share what i know about throttle position sensor....primarily it send ECU about the throttle position, how much is it open or closed... regarding its adjustment, i know that at desired RPM at idle ( after warm up ) it has to send voltage signal in a particular range.... i need to know that range and also need to know the pins on which i will connect a multimeter or volt meter to calibrate it correctly.... as per my understanding, if TPS is not calibrated correctly the car hesitates during acceleration.. the engine in question is SUZUKI G16B and it has throttle position sensor attached at back of throttle body and also can i clean it with a carburator cleaner before adjusting.... looking for response from brother Xulfiqar for a quick DIY.....
column2: You firstly have to reset the throttle plate stop screw to factory spec as the CNG installers move it for raising idle rpm (stupid) - then adjust the throttle position sensor, its usually 0.45-0.55 volts on japanese cars. Once done - adjust idle rpm with the airbypass screw on top of the throttle. to get an idea of the throttle plate stop screw, look in the manual or get another untouched throttle and using feeler gauges on the blade/bore clearance, adjust yours to match it.

column1: i need to adjust the throttle position sensor for my baleno, i need help regarding that ...specially from Xulfiqar. first i wanna share what i know about throttle position sensor....primarily it send ECU about the throttle position, how much is it open or closed... regarding its adjustment, i know that at desired RPM at idle ( after warm up ) it has to send voltage signal in a particular range.... i need to know that range and also need to know the pins on which i will connect a multimeter or volt meter to calibrate it correctly.... as per my understanding, if TPS is not calibrated correctly the car hesitates during acceleration.. the engine in question is SUZUKI G16B and it has throttle position sensor attached at back of throttle body and also can i clean it with a carburator cleaner before adjusting.... looking for response from brother Xulfiqar for a quick DIY.....
column2: your method requires that the throttle blade stop screw be set to factory spec first - what you are achieving by your method is to calibrate the idle signal from the sensor to the ECU. (movement till 0.7mm clearance at the stop screw is idle) above that is rev. If your throttle plate is not opened up to the required airflow your engine will be out of tune - no matter if the TPS sensor is giving a correct signal. But if your car is on CNG then this is the best compromise you can adjust to.

column1: i need to adjust the throttle position sensor for my baleno, i need help regarding that ...specially from Xulfiqar. first i wanna share what i know about throttle position sensor....primarily it send ECU about the throttle position, how much is it open or closed... regarding its adjustment, i know that at desired RPM at idle ( after warm up ) it has to send voltage signal in a particular range.... i need to know that range and also need to know the pins on which i will connect a multimeter or volt meter to calibrate it correctly.... as per my understanding, if TPS is not calibrated correctly the car hesitates during acceleration.. the engine in question is SUZUKI G16B and it has throttle position sensor attached at back of throttle body and also can i clean it with a carburator cleaner before adjusting.... looking for response from brother Xulfiqar for a quick DIY.....
column2: the 2.5v you have is called bias voltage, its a self test from ECU. Replace the TPS if you have 3.16V on idle position - its either broken internally or jammed at full and causing the ECU to go into "clear flood" mode on cranking. The idle position is usually 0.3~0.8V and WOT is 3.2~4.5V

column1: i need to adjust the throttle position sensor for my baleno, i need help regarding that ...specially from Xulfiqar. first i wanna share what i know about throttle position sensor....primarily it send ECU about the throttle position, how much is it open or closed... regarding its adjustment, i know that at desired RPM at idle ( after warm up ) it has to send voltage signal in a particular range.... i need to know that range and also need to know the pins on which i will connect a multimeter or volt meter to calibrate it correctly.... as per my understanding, if TPS is not calibrated correctly the car hesitates during acceleration.. the engine in question is SUZUKI G16B and it has throttle position sensor attached at back of throttle body and also can i clean it with a carburator cleaner before adjusting.... looking for response from brother Xulfiqar for a quick DIY.....
column2: as I said - the ECU is going into "clear flood" mode. In this mode the injectors will not fire - its the same concept and phenomenon of starting a carby car which is "over" by pressing the accelerator to full to allow air to get in to the overrich combustion chambers. Change your TPS and install it correctly. At idle it should be not more than 0.2~0.9V The reason its starting on disconnect is because the ECU has a failsafe mode in it which is basically batch firing the injectors at a given rpm value - this provides really bad fuel economy but enables the engine to run in order to get to a workshop.

column1: i need to adjust the throttle position sensor for my baleno, i need help regarding that ...specially from Xulfiqar. first i wanna share what i know about throttle position sensor....primarily it send ECU about the throttle position, how much is it open or closed... regarding its adjustment, i know that at desired RPM at idle ( after warm up ) it has to send voltage signal in a particular range.... i need to know that range and also need to know the pins on which i will connect a multimeter or volt meter to calibrate it correctly.... as per my understanding, if TPS is not calibrated correctly the car hesitates during acceleration.. the engine in question is SUZUKI G16B and it has throttle position sensor attached at back of throttle body and also can i clean it with a carburator cleaner before adjusting.... looking for response from brother Xulfiqar for a quick DIY.....
column2: find out the volts of stock engine setup and set with voltmeter.

column1: Comments, suggestions, from where to get it done and ideas would be helpful. my car's body is gone for body work, after everything is done I want to get it undercoated - aim is to reduce noise and heat transfer into cabin. what to undercoat the car with? Ideas and suggestions are welcomed!
column2: brownrose78;2832421: 2c point is good Xulfi r u in khi or houston & where in khi 3m rubberised coating available, can it remove afterward or stick permanently & will not it cause more weight? Im in Houston as my title says, The 3M coating is available at Amin Paints in DHA phase 2 extension behind the mitsubishi workshop. Its a one time thing, once sprayed it does not come off - and the total weight increase of the car would be about 3 or 4 kg I think, Now if you spray diesel fuel or engine oil regularly under your car - it will literally become such a mess that you wont want to own your car anymore. The coating is only applied to body structures and not suspension subframes, exhausts etc.

column2: Docfazz;3256392: Hello, I am considering buying a Suzuki Liana due to its low resale value and nice interior. I am thinking of getting a 2005-2006 model, possibly priced between 6 to 6.5 lakh. I saw your thread about your interest in buying a Baleno. Why didn't you choose Liana instead? When I sold my previous Baleno, I had planned to buy a Liana from 06 or 07. Here in Islamabad, it ranges from 700k to 775k in good condition. However, many people advised against buying a Liana due to problems with its coils and expensive parts. But, in my opinion (shared by some Liana owners who are my friends), if you can afford to get all the necessary service and work done by Suzuki professionals, then Liana is a good option. But if you prefer going to local mechanics, then Liana is not a suitable choice. I decided to go for the Baleno again, despite it being more expensive than Liana. This is because local mechanics are able to handle it easily and its parts are relatively less expensive (or at least I believe so). Plus, it fits in my garage, unlike larger cars such as Liana, City > 2004, Civic, Corolla, etc.

column2: i have Pirelli P3000 as my all season / winter tires (they are M&S rated) and i must say that they are good. The Pirelli P6000 (the successor to P3000) are equally good and are also OEM on alot of Ford cars here in Canada. So among the list posted by RedBull...P6000 would be my choice. You cant go wrong with Pirelli. Just make sure when you get the new tire...the tread depth is atleast 10/32nd..so they dont sell you something used.

column1: Can anyone tell me how much Pirelli Tyres cost for a size of 15/205? Also, which brand should I consider for a smooth ride on the rough roads of Karachi? Additionally, I would like to know the location of a Pirelli dealer. The vehicle in question is a BMW 316i E-36. Thank you.
column2: You are right, Red Bull. It is priced at P400, not P6000, at Charter www.1010tires.com. They have customer reviews for all types of tires imaginable.

column1: Can you please suggest a good auto body repair shop in Lahore? Also, what would be the expected cost for the work shown in the attached pictures?

column1: AoA I noticed a few small rust spots around the area encompassing wheel and suspension etc. They don't look like they've penetrated the metal too much and look more like on the surface. Would Rubberized undercoating as the one from 3M recommended for the car's undercarriage? Or there would be a better option especially in terms of undercoating material. Also who would be a good / reliable option to take the car in for applying the coat and degreasing work in Karachi.
column2: If you use the rubber spray coat, you should never let any sort of oil or petroleum contact it (like service station) - It will soften and bubble it off.

column1: AoA I noticed a few small rust spots around the area encompassing wheel and suspension etc. They don't look like they've penetrated the metal too much and look more like on the surface. Would Rubberized undercoating as the one from 3M recommended for the car's undercarriage? Or there would be a better option especially in terms of undercoating material. Also who would be a good / reliable option to take the car in for applying the coat and degreasing work in Karachi.
column2: if you spray your car with oil or diesel fuel underneath, no coating whether rubber or wax based will survive.

column1: AoA I noticed a few small rust spots around the area encompassing wheel and suspension etc. They don't look like they've penetrated the metal too much and look more like on the surface. Would Rubberized undercoating as the one from 3M recommended for the car's undercarriage? Or there would be a better option especially in terms of undercoating material. Also who would be a good / reliable option to take the car in for applying the coat and degreasing work in Karachi.
column2: Yes - wax coating is very good in protection, the rubber undercoat sold in spray cans are for repairing the broken off factory undercoat only. Dont cover the whole underbody with it. use a spray wax coat under it just like the factory did.

column1: AoA I noticed a few small rust spots around the area encompassing wheel and suspension etc. They don't look like they've penetrated the metal too much and look more like on the surface. Would Rubberized undercoating as the one from 3M recommended for the car's undercarriage? Or there would be a better option especially in terms of undercoating material. Also who would be a good / reliable option to take the car in for applying the coat and degreasing work in Karachi.
column2: Body cavity wax coat is available in Pakistan, go to a proper autobody paint supply store and ask for “neechay wali jenyan isspray” when asked for kalar Tell them peela wala. Unfortunately you will have to use these weird namings as the people running such business have no clue what they actually sell.

column1: AoA I noticed a few small rust spots around the area encompassing wheel and suspension etc. They don't look like they've penetrated the metal too much and look more like on the surface. Would Rubberized undercoating as the one from 3M recommended for the car's undercarriage? Or there would be a better option especially in terms of undercoating material. Also who would be a good / reliable option to take the car in for applying the coat and degreasing work in Karachi.
column2: Fluidfilm and Nuxodol are already available for purchase in Pakistan, as well as 3M. Alternatively, you can also choose to do it yourself (DIY).

column2: When I was in Karachi, the 2 places I bought these were the paint selling shop in plaza (preedy station) or in dha (next to the old mitsi dealer shop)

column1: AoA I noticed a few small rust spots around the area encompassing wheel and suspension etc. They don't look like they've penetrated the metal too much and look more like on the surface. column2: You can use Rustoleum or Permatex Rubberized anti-rust spray as a do-it-yourself solution. To check their availability, please visit https://www.adenwalla.org/products/35.

column1: Aoa. I have to give my car to an Auto Workshop for an insurance claim. Mechanic said it would take 2 days to complete the job. Allah pe tawakkal k baad what precautions should I take for my car's internal parts and it's safety while it is at the workshop for 2days.
column2: please remove every bit & piece of personal stuff, as in everything from car cabin even a plastic cup be removed and coins from ashtray. count items in trunk and snap pictures. Take odo meter snap shot. - count & identify back when collecting car Good luck

column1: Aoa. I have to give my car to an Auto Workshop for an insurance claim. Mechanic said it would take 2 days to complete the job. Allah pe tawakkal k baad what precautions should I take for my car's internal parts and it's safety while it is at the workshop for 2days.
column2: Itny tension hai to you should visit the workshop daily to keep a follow up on the work being done. This way you can keep a check if they working on the rear fender, why is the bonnet open. Yes change of parts is very common. I gave my Cultus to Suzuki in 2022 for bonnet repair job, later I came to know rear bumper lights were not working on close inspection the wires were disconnected. They probably replaced the rear bumper with another car in haste.

column1: Aoa. I have to give my car to an Auto Workshop for an insurance claim. Mechanic said it would take 2 days to complete the job. Allah pe tawakkal k baad what precautions should I take for my car's internal parts and it's safety while it is at the workshop for 2days.
column2: Thanks for the response. I had these things in my mind. What I'm worried more about is the parts (spark plugs etc) and fluids protection. I have recently changed engine oil.

column1: Aoa. I have to give my car to an Auto Workshop for an insurance claim. Mechanic said it would take 2 days to complete the job. Allah pe tawakkal k baad what precautions should I take for my car's internal parts and it's safety while it is at the workshop for 2days.
column2: Yes things are stolen or replaced at workshops. New spark plugs from my friend's car were exchanged with old ones while his car was at the workshop. Allah tawakkal hi hai sub kuch.

column2: Toyota Islamabad Motors bad experience General Car Discussion Summary 1. Toyota Islamabad motors stole ignition coils 2. Were caught and confessed 3. Replaced the stolen with new and apologized 4. Pictures attached (Toyota Islamabad appears as Suzuki on map because they are close to each other) Detail I have been buying and maintaining cars from Toyota Islamabad motors for past 12 years. Few days ago I took one of my cars there for some body and paint work, car was delivered 2-3 days late bodywork was okayish. When the car was ready for delivery the engine… Toyota islamabad motors steals stuff from cars for sure heard from many people but didnt believe until they stole ignition coils from my car, i caught them and they provided new ones (see the thread above) You cant be sure of everything just take pictures of engine bay and frequently visit the workshop.

column1: I got my car’s front bumper painted and it wasn’t done properly due to which the side fender and bonnet had some roughness on its surface. Is there a solution to fix this back to original form? Secondly if anyone could guide on best dent/paint services in Rwp/Isb? TIA
column2: did you go back for compound/cutting? its over spray and painter will fix it will cutting on the bumper.

column1: I got my car’s front bumper painted and it wasn’t done properly due to which the side fender and bonnet had some roughness on its surface. Is there a solution to fix this back to original form? Secondly if anyone could guide on best dent/paint services in Rwp/Isb? TIA
column2: You can have the affected areas repainted by a professional car repair shop. I also once saw a video of how they leveled the surface using a clay bar and polishing compound. However, this may not be as effective if the roughness is caused by a significant difference in paint texture or color. And if you do not have certain skills and perform this procedure incorrectly, it can cause even more damage.

column1: Yesterday's hailstorm was very rough and my car although parked inside garage but unfortunately the trunk was not in shade. There are around 15-20 small dents on the trunk and as the color of my car is black plus i try to keep it very clean all the time those dents are really haunting me now I tried searching on forums for any solution like vacuum suction or dry denting but couldn't find any answer. So can any body guide me what should I do to remove those dents? I took it to a reliable denter but he was of idea that these cant be repaired and either i let them like this or i should replace the trunk with a new one same color (which i dont want to do). Also read somewhere to use hair dryer to heat up the dented area and then try removing it. Does that work? ---feeling depressed---
column2: redbee;4711844: Bro, you're not the only one. on 16 February the same thing happened with my Civic too, hail storm completely destroy trunk and rear fender of my car. it was also parked inside the garage. . and very next day i went to Honda Point Lahore and they said this is the 9th car arrived which is affected with the hail storm. . anyhow, i repair and repaint my car. . did you repair your car? "Hail size was a table tennis ball and storm remain 10 to 15 minutes but it reduce the worth of my car, since then i start feeling little bit fear from bad weather, i keep eyes on weather forecast etc. these are natural disasters and we have to deal with that but Thanks God our lose is minimum" and be careful next few days it's expected heavy rain and storm in Lahore on this Sunday. . had been through same my altos roof was damaged half of it in hail strom back in 2013 and it was depressing to see these dents we took out some dents in the bonnet but roof remained as it is now on 25th feb there was a hail storm and checked it before here is what i did parked the car in front inside took out 2 of un used Raziais one razai convering bonnet and half of roof and second was covering back side till the bumper and on top car was covered with an after market cover i did this practice for 3 days and on 25h all hell broke loose from 12am to 5am constant hail and as the time went by their size became larger checked my car in the morning and by grace of Allah not a single hail dent if u are on road and hail starts try to get into some shade or petrol pump do not continue to drive unless u guys gave a pre 90s car also in home that razai technique works

column1: After much thought i believe this is the right place for proper advice; Currently i have Sony GTF 6939 Speakes and Kenwood KFC W3010 Sub Need an amplifier and an android screen Planning on buying Sony XNM10004 amplifier and Orientech 1gb,16gb for the android Would this setup work together in harmony? Is the amplifier suitable for the woofer and the speakers? Would that android be able to support woofer and speakers ? Further guidance regarding wiring and it's guage or any other guidelines would be appreciated Thankyou
column2: You sure you've written the amp model correct? You can use 8 gauge wiring. Ofc is better. Where exactly will you place the amplifier? What car is it?

column1: After much thought i believe this is the right place for proper advice; Currently i have Sony GTF 6939 Speakes and Kenwood KFC W3010 Sub Need an amplifier and an android screen Planning on buying Sony XNM10004 amplifier and Orientech 1gb,16gb for the android Would this setup work together in harmony? Is the amplifier suitable for the woofer and the speakers? Would that android be able to support woofer and speakers ? Further guidance regarding wiring and it's guage or any other guidelines would be appreciated Thankyou
column2: I would not recommend buying a Sony amplifier. Instead, I suggest considering Pioneer or Kenwood options, as they are of better quality. Sony speakers, on the other hand, are acceptable, but their amplifiers are not as reliable.

column1: After much thought i believe this is the right place for proper advice; Currently i have Sony GTF 6939 Speakes and Kenwood KFC W3010 Sub Need an amplifier and an android screen Planning on buying Sony XNM10004 amplifier and Orientech 1gb,16gb for the android Would this setup work together in harmony? column2: Get yourself a used branded player rather then wasting money on android panel

column1: AoA! There are 3 options I have come across: 1- Woofer Box and Amplifier in trunk. This occupies a lot of space. Will a small box with 6 inch woofer do the job? If yes the where can i get those from since they're not common. 2- Bass Tube in trunk It's famous that it occupies lesser space but I think it's just better fitting and better shaped. Otherwise it still occupies lots of area, almost equal to a box. They also come with built-in amplifier but need to know where I can get those in Karachi in cheaper price range. 3- Under-seat Subwoofer: This seem like a great option as it fits easily under car seat and has built-in amplifier. But some say that the built-in amplifier heats up quick as they are placed in confined spaces (like under the seat). Will it sound good if I place it in trunk? Also, will it give good quality bass if I don't intend to make people outside the car notice or listen? Just need normal bass inside the car. 4- Door Speakers Some sellers are also claiming that few JBL / Pioneer etc models will give normal/decent quality bass including the "humming". Others are saying it's not possible given the little space in doors. But then underseat woofer also works in little space.. 5- Free Air Also came across this option where the concept is to make your car's trunk or cabin a "box" for the woofer. No idea how to do that without lots of experiments and will it even work without much altering of interior. So what should I opt for given that I don't want to spend a lot. The car is new shape Honda City and it's just that the existing setup isn't giving any "humming" bass at all at any volume. Making the car vibrate or making the whole neighborhood listen is "not" what I want. Just decent bass inside the car at low & medium volumes. Will appreciate if someone can help me out with saving boot space and money both.
column2: under seat powered subs are absolutely fine. new ones are a bit expensive though. A member here usually lists them which come in japanese imports. That's the easiest bet. upgrading your stock speakers with some aftermarket ones will also increase the midbass you are looking for. But don'e expect wonders because your stock headunit doesnt produce the kind of power an amplifier would. Regardless, the difference will be quite noticeable over the stock speakers Sound deadening your doors will also increase midbass while eliminating unwanted resonance. Depending on the sub, a 10"-12" can easily fit in a 0.75-1 cu.ft sealed box which won't take that much space. The box does not need to be a square with a internal volume of 0.75-1 cu.ft. An angled box will take less space when pushed to the back of the trunk

Making the car vibrate or making the whole neighborhood listen is "not" what I want. Just decent bass inside the car at low & medium volumes. Will appreciate if someone can help me out with saving boot space and money both.
column2: It's the new shape city. But don't need any extreme bass or audiophile level stuff. Just normal bass at low/normal volumes.

column1: Hi all So i want to install a good sound system in my honda city 2020 and i wanna go with the components. It would be my first time using components, are they any good in providing efficient bass and sound in the car. One dealer suggested me to go with MTX Black Thunder BLK 625 with 2 channel rockmars amp 3600 watts. The price he gave me for black thunder 16k Rock mars 2 channel amp 6k Copper wiring 3k Is that a good build as i may be investing nearly 25k for this system. i need some good advice regarding this P.s i cant sacrifice my boot space for a subwoofer so i only want good quality speakers
column2: You may get better options in the same range. Flux neo would cost about 16k. Infinity alpha 650c are for around 13k and are more neutral sounding than MTX. there are even better options if you can raise taht budget to 20k with the JBL gto's, infinity reference etc. Never been a fan of any chinese amp like Rockmars etc. But since this is a begginer setup, you may opt for it to power your comps. However, to really setup a good sound stage, I'd suggest you also invest in a subwoofer in a sealed enclousure. So even if you can't get that now, I'd suggest you plan ahead and opt for a 4 channel amp so you may have 2 free channels to power up the sub. I'd suggest you opt for atleast some good quality ofc 8 gauge power/gnd wire and RCA cables. There are great stores to buy authentic items from so always mention which city you are from and members can help you out

column2: If you want bass. You won't be getting that with any component speakers. It will get better with sound damping the front doors but that alone would cost you more than what you're paying for the speakers.

column1: Hello guys, car in discussion is HONDA CITY IDSI recently, during a brief highway trip, the heat up sign showed. I stopped the car immediately, arranged water. It took me around 10-15 min. I opened the bonnet n filled the reservoir tank, but it had enough water as it seemed. Then opened radiator cap (there was no vapors) n poured water, but it seemed also had enough water. I drove back, n during this time many times heat sign showed n i turned off the engine, waited for some time and drove back home. I checked at parking, there was no water leak, fans were turning on (may be AC, as i didn't check without AC), and heat sign appearing. Due to heavy rains, i didn't get it checked for 2-3 weeks. Then, by connecting obd, i checked the temp rise via it. Before going to mechanic, i washed externally the radiator, if there was dust blocking heat flow. Then city drive rose the temp upto around 100°C. Mechanic suggested to get radiator cleaned, so i did. It was dirty but not that much as much. It seemed usual,radiator guy said, it was dirty. After reinstalling radiator, when he was checking for fans to run, temp rose to 115C n then he revved engine, there heat sign blinked n fan started. So i drove back to mechanic, he removed thermostat n said might there be blockage in the engine block. So, i asked him to close it as such n put in radiator flush in it. Then on next day, i drove around 150 km on highway. Temp was rising upto 100C but when i came back, noticed that rubber hose to heater core was leaking, got it done. Next day, i had to go to krchi early morning, so i drove with flush in the engine, temp was around 70C. I replaced the flush with tap water n came to my city driving arounf 500km. At time temp was 70-90C. Since, there has been no leakage, what could be the issue??? And now i m planning to clean the system with fresh water, get thermostat reinstalled and fill up with coolant. Another question is should i reinstall the same thermostat??? I checked the thermostat if it was working or not, so i tested it in boiling water, it was opening n closing(i m not sure if it was fully opening or closing but it was working) thermostat pics attached.
column2: If this is the condition of the thermostat after the flush, your flush was fake/bad/useless. You have got a lot of scale deposit in the engine.

column2: zeus65: You once suggested to use non foaming soap ad well. Should i use it too before citric acid flush???And is it necessary to use hose pipe to drain all flush, as i might not have the access. The soap is used when you had a headgasket failure or for some oddball reason (like crackhead ustaad adding a cup of oil/diesel etc to radiator) - it washes out the oil. Once the oil is out, citric acid is used to clean the system as the acid cannot emulsify the oil. If you dont have access to a waterhose, then you will be draining and filling a lot.

column1: All, Can any body here please tell how can we test the ignition coil primary circuit, if its working or not. problem is unable to start the car, it takes self but there is no current in the lead coming out (secondary circuit) from coil to distributor. This happens rarely. but i am unable to diagnose what is the root cause. Road side mechanics are able to start the car by fiddling with the wiring (probably making a direct contact from battery to coil) but they themselves have no clue what they do to make it start. Things already tested and tried. have changed/ checked the coil lead. have checked when ever this happens the coil gets current (12v) from battery when the switch is in ON position. There is no current in the coil secondary coil when i crank the engine. coil seems to be in good health, once it get started it runs like a charm not a single missing what so ever. Not sure how to check the pulse circuit ( from distributor) how can i check if the distributor is generating the required pulse or not ? The most annoying thing is this behavior occurs rarely, and leaves back no symptoms to trace it. My personal opinion is that there could be some fault with coil primary circuit, but i am not sure how to test the circuit completely. Any help in this regard will be highly appreciated. Thanks.
column2: if yours is the EFI cultus - then make absolutely sure that you are not having simple main relay issues, In an EFI engine - the distributor houses two or one sensors - just cam or crank and cam both. and all send signals to the ECU - the ECU then switches the coil on and off for firing the plugs. Its not a direct connection to the coil. By your problem it seems that you are seeing crank sensor issues As for checking the sensor signal pulses, you need a DVOM to measure AC volts while cranking, if you see slight voltage on the sensors output you are good, OR if you want to be real finicky use an oscilloscope

column1: All, Can any body here please tell how can we test the ignition coil primary circuit, if its working or not. problem is unable to start the car, it takes self but there is no current in the lead coming out (secondary circuit) from coil to distributor. This happens rarely. but i am unable to diagnose what is the root cause. Road side mechanics are able to start the car by fiddling with the wiring (probably making a direct contact from battery to coil) but they themselves have no clue what they do to make it start. Not sure how to check the pulse circuit ( from distributor) how can i check if the distributor is generating the required pulse or not ? The most annoying thing is this behavior occurs rarely, and leaves back no symptoms to trace it. My personal opinion is that there could be some fault with coil primary circuit, but i am not sure how to test the circuit completely. Any help in this regard will be highly appreciated. Thanks.
column2: your distributor has a sensor inside it - its the cam position sensor, your crank position sensor would be beneath the main crank pulley.. The 12V that you are seeing at the sensor is activation current from the main relay. Im not in paki at the moment and Im a little hazy on the new cultus, but its distributor should have three wires coming to it, - one 12V +ve one 12V -ve and one signal output - from the cam position sensor, I dont believe that a modern EFI car can be equipped without cam and crank sensors, (come to think of it, how the ECU time the injectors and ignition then).

column2: itsgumbys;2366720: @Xplorer, one thing i have noticed... there is only one output coming out from Distributor and going into the coil (primary input- ground) via a fuse. There is no input going into the distributor for any sensor. what i believe is that there is some mechanical switch ( may b some contact point sort of rotor) in the distributor which operates a magnetic switch (pulse generator). The only difference i see is this magnetic switch has been replaced with traditional "POINT" we used to have in old cars. i have consulted few motor electricians locally including PAK SUZUKI, and they say there is no sensor in the distributor. One more thing i would like to know.... from where the coil gets primary current when u crank the engine ? definitely there are 2 circuits which provide the current to coil.. one in the ON position and the other while cranking. Thanks. So you mean to say there is no ignitor in the ignition circuit and there is no wiring going from the distributor into the main EFI wiring harness, but somehow this engine runs. HOW does it adjust ignition timing? If pak suzuki are telling you there is nothing in the distributor so what is that little thing inside the distributor, The only similar thing Ive seen to what you are saying was an old Mazda 4 cyl 626 EFI setup, The engine had a crank and cam sensor and also had a distributor, inside the distributor was the tiny ignitor which was fed input from the ECM - and a couple of wires ran from it to the ignition coil placed outside the distributor. The cranking circuit is also connected to the ECU - its branched off from the key that makes the ECM go into starting mode - higher fuel flow from injectors and advanced ignition timing forcing the engine to start easily.

column1: Guys, I have finally completed what I always wanted to do (well almost!). I have (almost) a ready Mehran fully BEV (Battery Electric Vehicle) ready assembled right here in Karachi. I would be testing and tuning it for the next few weeks but if my calculations are correct it would be 8-9 times cheaper to operate than a conventional alto (including engine maintenance). My question is - does it make sense to commercialize the idea given the electricity situation? What if I have multiple shops which can provide replacement batteries so that you dont need to charge your battery at home? Just looking for feedback! Will post pics soon!

column1: Guys - need guidance. I need to equip my new car with an aftermarket sound system It's a civic 2022. Need to install front stage and amp with a decent headunit. My proposed items are: - Focal PS 165V1 for front with Trend Damping sheet on the door - Focal Auditor 4 channel or Hifonics 4ch or Gladen 4ch - Some good quality RC Leads with proper grounding. - Pioneer HU (need android auto) Budget is 200-250K. Keeping stock backstage on amp. Moderate gain level. No subwoofer. Please input on this setup.
column2: With that budget, the equipment you have posted in quite mediocre tbh. Also that Android auto unit might eat up majority of your budget.

column1: Guys - need guidance. I need to equip my new car with an aftermarket sound system It's a civic 2022. Need to install front stage and amp with a decent headunit. My proposed items are: - Focal PS 165V1 for front with Trend Damping sheet on the door - Focal Auditor 4 channel or Hifonics 4ch or Gladen 4ch - Some good quality RC Leads with proper grounding. - Pioneer HU (need android auto) Budget is 200-250K. Keeping stock backstage on amp. Moderate gain level. No subwoofer. Please input on this setup.
column2: For 250k, you can do much better for sure. Pioneers Android Auto compatible headunits start around 70k last I checked and go upto 100k or beyond. So it's upto you which one you want. Consider that prices might have fluctuated Something to remember, ALOT of the Focal stuff being sold here in Pakistan are copies and I'm talking about some pretty well known shops. Consider where you are buying your things from. Also, demo the speakers because you need to know what type of sound you like. Focals have a distinctive bright sound which some people love and some don't. @yawar538 might be aware of better components that are available in your budget. You can also contact Shehryar at soundvalley (pindi) or Haroon Radio in Karachi. Also, what exactly is trend dampening sheet?

column1: Guys is there a difference between cutting cream and Compound? If there is a difference, which one is better to use? Asking for white color car kindly share your experiences on this topic
column2: They are the same thing. Cutting cream is desi term used by our people. Right word is compound. Compounds are usually used for aggressive cutting.

column1: Guys is there a difference between cutting cream and Compound? If there is a difference, which one is better to use? Asking for white color car kindly share your experiences on this topic
column2: For water spots, try any descaler to remove them. Then use polish to remove the paint etchings. Polish is like compound but with less cutting ability. Don't confuse it with wax. People in Pakistan refer to wax as polish well. You can use vineger as an alternate to proper descaling product as Saad mention. Or you can use any budget descaling product from cash n carry like from astonish. I have personally used vinegar technique and found it pretty effective if you use the proper technique. The key is to let the water spots soak in vinegar for 5 min and then try to wipe the area using microfiber towel. Repeat these steps until desired results are achieved. You can use a towel soaked in vinegar solution or use any wax applicator pad soaked in the same solution and keep using cross hatch pattern until the water spots are gone

column1: Guys is there a difference between cutting cream and Compound? If there is a difference, which one is better to use? Asking for white color car kindly share your experiences on this topic
column2: I am not sure what it's called by our painters. There are multiple terms you will find on products label like polish, polishing compound, medium cut polish, medium cut compound, etc. Some products have misleading labels. You have to read the product description in order understand what exactly the product is. Here are two examples of medium cut polish/coumpound from Soft99 range Polishing Compound https://pastewax.pk/soft99-polishing-compound4 Rubbing Compound https://pastewax.pk/soft99-rubbing-compound-all-purpose3

column1: Guys is there a difference between cutting cream and Compound? If there is a difference, which one is better to use? Asking for white color car kindly share your experiences on this topic
column2: It's best to remove the minerals in water spots using descaler first. Then use polish or compound based on the damage that water spots left.

column1: Guys is there a difference between cutting cream and Compound? If there is a difference, which one is better to use? Asking for white color car kindly share your experiences on this topic
column2: Sir for water marks there are proper products like koch chemie waterspot remover and 3d waterspot remover but hack is to use 50/50 dilution of vinegar with water. For dirt and grimw you have to buy a clay bar which will remove inbeded contaminants

column1: Guys is there a difference between cutting cream and Compound? If there is a difference, which one is better to use? Asking for white color car kindly share your experiences on this topic
column2: Bhai I have dealt with a similar issue recently. The yellowing or spots on my car were of very minor nature so a simple 'Scratch out' available everywhere solved my issue. What I did was that I attaches a cotton pad attachment on my home drill and primed the pad with Scratch out and used it throughout. Results were amazing and the car looked new again. Scratch out is so fine that it cannot dig deep into paint. My drill is a variable speed one so I kept the rpms low just to be safe. I was reluctant before trying this but I was pleasantly surprised after getting amazing results. Do apply wax or paint sealant afterwards for long term protection and cover your car with a good waterproof cover. In Lahore nowadays due to pollution its a common problem. Normal/factory chrome parts get corroded and dripping water smears that corrosion on every rain. Acid rains are also a big reason.

column1: Guys is there a difference between cutting cream and Compound? If there is a difference, which one is better to use? Asking for white color car kindly share your experiences on this topic
column2: use a product called scratch out. Its very thin and has super thin grains so it can't harm the paint.

column2: please do send an email to customer care section of both oil companies and obtain the fuel data you want for comparison. please do not forget to share your findings here for common knowledge, Thank you. PSO Customer care3 Shell Customer care3

column1: Hello everyone, We all know High Octane of Shell is more expensive then PSO. Is there any difference in quality or both are same? In terms of RON and additives, what is the difference between Shell V-Power and PSO Octane+ ?
column2: Shell V-Power has an octane rating of 95 Ron, while PSO Octane+ has a rating of 97 Ron. However, the marketing of Shell V-Power is considered to be superior, which leads to more people favoring V-Power. In my opinion, Total Excellium is the best option.

column1: Hello everyone, We all know High Octane of Shell is more expensive then PSO. Is there any difference in quality or both are same? In terms of RON and additives, what is the difference between Shell V-Power and PSO Octane+ ?
column2: Hello everyone. I am replying my own question. After deep study i found that Shell V-Power is better than PSO Octane+ because it have better additives. Thank you.

column1: Hello everyone, We all know High Octane of Shell is more expensive then PSO. Is there any difference in quality or both are same? In terms of RON and additives, what is the difference between Shell V-Power and PSO Octane+ ?
column2: Indeed Shell is 95, PSO is 97 and Total is 98, but Shell also have cleaning agents that may good against deposits on injectors, valves, throttle and etc. If you have a vehicle that need 92 RON then 95, 97 or 98 are waste except they have cleaning agents. Check PSO and Total official websites, they do not claim cleaning agents and it's only Shell USP.

column1: I have come across two kinds of sprays that seem to be used in cleaning MAF sensor, need help of experts to know which one I can use. Pictures are attached.
column2: there is no set time interval for cleaning. The cleaning has been put by diagnostic technicians. Cleaning a hot wire MAF is done when the hot wires become contaminated with oil or dirt - This is seen via the MAF flow PID in OBD diagnosis - if the sensor is not registering correct values then the MAF sensor is suspect (please note the suspect). The MAF sensor can be registering a fault even when there is a leak in the air tube after the MAF or even the intake manifold gasket or even throttle body gasket. Diagnose it correctly first then proceed to clean. Diagnosis also encompasses reading the fuel trims (where applicable). Dont just make it a habit of shooting cleaners at the MAF every 6 months because you think its a good idea, It can destroy it too. Also note that not all types of MAF can be cleaned, e.g. hot film maf or karmann vortex type should never be cleaned with anything. It kills them dead immediately. - Use a non residue degreaser to clean it - make sure that degreaser does not harm the nylon housing of the MAF either.

column1: I have come across two kinds of sprays that seem to be used in cleaning MAF sensor, need help of experts to know which one I can use. Pictures are attached.
column2: If the MAF sensor isnt too dirty, just clean it with a dry cotton swab. If its too dirty and has a lot of oil residue on it, then only use the contact cleaner and not the degreaser.

column1: I have come across two kinds of sprays that seem to be used in cleaning MAF sensor, need help of experts to know which one I can use. Pictures are attached.
column2: shabbir233;4976219: Plz educate me what is MAF ? MAF Sensor, short for Mass Air Flow Sensor is a component installed in the air cleaner of the car which measures the amount of air coming into the engine and the temperature as well and the input from it is one of the factors that help the ecu decide how much fuel is to be pumped into the cylinders.

column1: I have come across two kinds of sprays that seem to be used in cleaning MAF sensor, need help of experts to know which one I can use. Pictures are attached.
column2: I have used Contact Cleaner. It works fine and evaporates quickly without leaving residue.

column2: use contact cleaner, always works perfectly! the degreaser might leave residue on the maf which can mess up the working.

column2: sbnshahid;4976140: I specifically asked the shopkeeper that which one will leave less residue, he said degreaser will leave it more dry. So I bought degreaser. Should I go with it then ? Going all the way to hafeez center is a hectic job :/ bro what i told you is from the experience of me and some of my friends, it would be a more hectic job to find a new maf if the shopkeeper is wrong.

column1: I have come across two kinds of sprays that seem to be used in cleaning MAF sensor, need help of experts to know which one I can use. Pictures are attached.
column2: Sure! MAF stands for Mass Air Flow. It refers to a sensor used in automotive engines to measure the amount of air entering the engine. This data is crucial for the engine control unit to calculate the appropriate fuel injection and ignition timing. The MAF sensor helps ensure accurate air-to-fuel ratios, allowing the engine to run efficiently and smoothly.

column1: AoA. I am looking for an after market android auto apple carplay enabled headunit in Rwp/Isb. In Rwp Saddar, majority of the shopkeepers don't know about it. In Isb, some are selling Chinese ones. Any idea about authorised Pioneer/Kenwood/Sony dealership which can offer a quality product at reasonable price?? In case anyone is interested to sell a used one, please share details.
column2: There are two options. Either buy a reputed brand head unit with Android auto / car play enabled. It will cost you more and difficult to find. Or Buy a good quality Chinese one with minimum 4GB RAM and 64 GB ROM with Android 10. For Android auto / car play there comes an adapter (wired and wireless) which will be connected to head unit and enable the required Android auto / car play features. It's kind of 3rd party solution but it works. Another option is You can install HeadunitReloaded Android app on head unit, it enables the Android auto functionality only..no car play. It's demo version, if you feel comfortable you can purchase full version in only 6$ I think. Personally I am using Headunit Reloaded app on Android 8 based head unit

column1: Recently I have installed a GPS/GSM tracker on all my three cars. After doing a lot of surfing on internet I have came across a dealer who provides a similar GPS/GSM tracker being sold in Local Market for Rs 35000. This dealer has provided the same tracker for price USD 100 including the shipment cost and Rs 1200 was charged by the custom on delivery. I am very satisfied with this tracker as I can trace my cars by only calling the tracker which disconnects my call and sends me a SMS with information of Latitude, Longitude, Speed, direction along with a URL which once I click in my mobile then a browser opens with Google Map showing exactly where the vehicle is. I can Arm, Disarm, set up geo fencing, set up speed limit, change passwords, listen inside car and break Engine/fuel supply from my Mobile Phone. column1: Hi guys , I own a 2015 model mira eis ....it's bearing were making sound for the last couple of months so I got both front bearings changed ....after the bearings change , I'm facing several issues which I believe are interlinked 1. Car speedometer show higher speed than actual ....it increases to 100 while I'm driving at 60 2. The car looses pulses on higher speed i.e. 90-100(showing on Meter 135) , the car pulse looses pulse for brief moment and then it's back however the behavior is constant when driving on higher speed 3. Eco idle light is flashing and it's not working once the speed crosses 30 km/hr I've got the abs checked and there are no error codes . Got zero calibration done but still issues are there . Got battery replaced a month ago so it definitely it is not the cause , removed terminal for 30 minutes but issue not resolved. Mechanics keep telling me to buy kabli hubs which I'm not in favor off. The trc light flashed initially after changing bearing and now it doesn't work.....it works up til the speed of 30 km/hr , after that the button doesn't work Please advise way forward or a decent mechanic with a balanced head over his shoulders to identify and advise correct remedy (tired of jugaaro ustaads) I am located in Lahore and can take car anywhere in Lahore
column2: Mechanic messed up with wiring while doing the bearing job, check for wire grips for bad connection or dirty connector as it disturbs the connection. meerzzz1: I am located in Lahore and can take car anywhere in Lahore You can visit @syncview
