column2: y dont u try one thing from my side as iv experienced it in my car ! atleast put half / full petrol in ur tank so that there is enuf petrol in ur car and then try ! the logic is that when petrol is less in tank then wen u take turna the petrol slides to one side and fuel pump has decrease of petrol in its area of suckshun ! then when the car is straight the fuel come to its place and after some time fuel pump withdrws the fuel ! so i think thats y ur car engin stops for some time ! if this is the problem then tell me will help u further in it ! also try ur car on a strait road for some time without brakes as braking makes the fuel come on front of the tank ! i dont know where is the pump or the pipe located in ur tank ! did u understand my point ?

column1: Basic problem was car felt heavy to drive in night with lights on. Thought to have alternator tested. Recently placed new belt and appropriate tension was given. Car is Cold so is alternator No Load Condition:  @ idle Battery Voltage = 14.2 V @2k RPM Battery Voltage = 14.2 v On- Load: Head- Lights
column2: Low and High Beam  @ idle Battery Voltage = 13.7 V @2k RPM Battery Voltage = 13.7 v With AC along with blower motor  @ idle Battery Voltage = 13.4 V @2k RPM Battery Voltage = 13.4 v Car and Alternator are hot   No Load Condition:  @ idle Battery Voltage = 13.7 V @2k RPM Battery Voltage = 13.9 v On- Load: Head- Lights
column3: Low and High Beam  @ idle Battery Voltage = 13.4 V @2k RPM Battery Voltage = 13.5 v With AC along with blower motor  @ idle Battery Voltage = 12.9 V @2k RPM Battery Voltage = 13.4 v From tests above i think alternator 's voltage regulator is weak i guess as it gets too hot under load. You cant touch it. As compared to power pump that is on same bracket so if it was engine transferring heat it should be almost same. Engine = F18B( 99 accord ) @syncview @Xulfiqar @spectra @SER_GTR Click here to go to the SOLUTION3
column4: Seems Like Rectifier Plate.......! You Have To Inspect It With DMM In Order To Know What Is It... Mostly Its Rectifiers Blown Or Going Weak And Then BLOWN...And If You Are Lucky...You Find The Matching Plate..Else You Need A Whole Alternator ....! This Is Alarming.....Get Your Backups....Before One Day It Denies To Charge At ALL...!

column1: My brake shoes are good but the pedal goes way down. So I am thinking of changing the brake oil for the first time. How much will it cost. labour plus oil? Where to get it done? Someone who will bleed the air out properly too.
column2: All cars require brake fluid changes annually to prevent internal rusting of brake systems caused by moisture absorption. It's essential to consult the owner's manual for specific maintenance guidelines. For instance, Toyota Xli typically requires brake fluid changes every 40,000 kilometers, along with transmission and power steering oil replacements at the same interval. The user manual outlines detailed periodic maintenance schedules, including conditions for changing gear oil, which can be obtained from a 3S dealer. When planning brake fluid changes, consider sourcing genuine fluid from trusted dealerships to ensure authenticity. Service charges for brake fluid changes vary, with some dealerships offering comprehensive brake services at competitive rates. Prioritizing preventive maintenance, including brake service and suspension checks, can significantly enhance vehicle safety and prevent accidents, as experienced firsthand by a grateful driver who avoided two potential collisions thanks to recent maintenance work.

column1: Assalamualaikum. I have a Toyota Corolla AE100 - 5a-fe Engine SE LIMITED JDM Year 94 which has an engine vibration issue. Both my mechanic and friend have informed me that the vibration is due to weak engine foundations. Therefore, I am planning to replace the old foundations with new ones.  -  - 1. Can you suggest if I should get genuine Japanese foundations or opt for ones from Thailand? And if Japanese foundations are better, where should I purchase them from? I have already provided my car's engine and chassis numbers to my uncle in Sharjah, UAE. He found out that the foundations cost 865 dirhams (23,500 PKR) there, and I would also need to pay additional shipping charges of 2000 to 3000 PKR.  -  - 2. Are the foundations available in the Plaza Market in Karachi better than the ones in Sharjah, UAE? Or should I buy them from Karachi instead? -  - 3. I only need a set of 4 mounts from Sharjah, UAE. Would it be better to change all 4 foundations for improved performance, or should I only change the one that is causing the issue? The rubber on both the front and rear foundations is quite soft, and there are 1 or 2 minor cracks. I haven't checked the gearbox and driving seat foundations yet. -  - One more thing, this car was imported from Japan in 2006 and has been with me since then. A few years ago, my brother had replaced the mount for the driving seat with a used one. As of now, the car has covered a total of 87,000 km since 2006, with 72,000 km already driven in Japan. So, it has covered a total of 159,000 km. Thank you.
column2: For your Toyota Corolla AE100 with a 5A-FE engine experiencing vibration issues, it's recommended to choose genuine Japanese foundations, ensuring they are new stock for freshness. Purchasing locally in Karachi, possibly from a Toyota showroom, could be a reliable and cost-effective option. Considering the soft rubber and minor cracks in both front and rear foundations, it's advisable to replace all 4 foundations to enhance performance and address potential issues comprehensively.

column2: GoodMan7;4066878: Brother, local companies' ATF (Automatic Transmission Fluid) aren't good. Honestly, they must be chosen wisely; otherwise, they can harm the entire gear system like slow poison. I highly recommend using TOYOTA CVT FLUID TC, 4L Category: Transmission Fluid. Product Name: TOYOTA CVT FLUID TC Part No: 08886-02105 Type: Fully Synthetic Manufacturer: Exxon Mobil Japan Volume: 4L This is the best and purest synthetic gear oil for CVT engines. I'm sure that if you use it in your car, your car will feel as good as honey. You can find more information about this oil at https://www.pakwheels.com/forums/d-i-y-projects/168298-transmission-oil-change-toyota-vitz-belta-passo-toyota-k410-transmission I used T-IV (ATF) from Toyota, and it is really low-quality oil. Never use ATF from a local company if you want to keep your car happy. By the way, ZIC A+ is good engine oil. Have you tried ZIC OW? For your reference, it's even better than ZIC A+. Cheers and love. Bro, the Suzuki Alto 660 does not have a CVT transmission, so never use CVT oil, just use any ATF. Sent from my A900 using PW Forums mobile app

column1: Guys, I have Nissan Pino 660c auto transmission. What is the recommended lubricant grade for this car auto transmission and which brand in local market will do the job? I am using Zic A+ for engine oil. Regards,
column2: Atif_Khan;4067092: Thanks Goodman for the reply.. You are right about the quality of usual available ATF oils but dont you think that Toyota CVT will be too much good for 660 cc car with small transmission system. For Engine, now I am using Havoline due to 2 number Zic in the market. I have used Zic 0W for my City and it works nice with big engines. Brother, As we all generally know that main function of the engine or gear oil is to keep the smooth flow of internal moving parts and reducing their internal friction as minimum as possible. Using low grade ATF or any other cheap oil may harm internal parts (like slow poison). But using Good Grade CVT Oil will make your engine more than Happy. Every day your car itself will open the door for you to sit & enjoy the good drive. lol.... For ZIC, you are very right brother. There are so many fake oils in market now since last two years especially because of increasing deamnds. But luckily still we can trust XQ & OW but have to be purchase from genuine distributor. Zic's other oils, especially ZIC A+, A & Hi-Flow, ...... oh gosh, its hard to trust their quality. ZIC XQ & OW are good for new engines, either these are small cars or big. Similarly more than 70% people in market selling fake Havoline (deeping down their own graves), but the point is that who knows this fact or even who bother to know this naked truth !!! GOD BLESS US ALL. Cheers & LOVE.

column1: Hey PW members, Just wana share one of my brilliant n excellent experience with you guys...2 days earlier i had a straight crack in my car front windscreen due to the falling of cone shell from tree in storm...the crack grew somehow in a day...i got very much concerning abt dis situation as the windscreen was genuine n u guys better know it is almost difficult enough to find any genuine thing in Pakistan... The person is working as Professional Engineer here in Chaklala Air base and repairs windscreen of aircrafts / jets / aeroplanes with the help of laser technology...i was surprised to c such a professional person here in Rawalpindi...he literally repaired my car windscreen crack whch was getting deeper and deeper...and after the treatment it was almost invisible to the major extent to a common man...ppl suggested me to go for new windscreen replacement BUT u guys no na that original is original na so i decided to go for its repairing which was highly beneficial... i know that mostly ppl here in islb enjoy keeping very luxurious imported cars the original screen of whom is difficult enough to find in Pakistan...thats why i decided to share my this experience with u so that many people can be benefited from dis information. His telephone numbers are : 0300-5177500, 0332-5177500, 051-4856031 His shop is situated on cricket stadium double road near Abbasi CNG... his web site is : Shan Wind Screen390. You guys can have a look on his professional capacities on his web site.
column2: as soon as the crack start, cover it up with a tape, water proof and dust proof it then run to this guy, only then it can be fixed. an old expanding crack, which has been exposed to all sorts of dust etc cannot be repaired. column1: I just got some side screen shades for my Civic, and some dude told me that they are illegal. Isb police love to get ppl on anything. Any ideas?
column2: While there may be rumors suggesting that cars registered under women's names are allowed to use side shades, it's uncertain whether this is true. Additionally, obtaining permission from the Commissioner might grant permission, particularly for individuals with genuine skin conditions preventing sun exposure. While side shades may not be explicitly illegal, they pose hazards and require careful driving. In other countries like UAE and China, black tint is allowed, but such leniency is not observed due to law and order concerns in Pakistan. Islamabad police faced a setback when a driver contested a challan for using a mobile phone while driving, with the court ruling that no law prohibits such behavior. Similarly, whether screen shades are illegal under Islamabad's Motor Vehicle law should be verified, and contesting a ticket in court may be necessary. Despite being technically illegal, many drivers use tinted windows without police intervention, although fines ranging from 400 to 700 Rupees may be imposed if caught.

column1: Hi i have my Toyota corolla 2.0d 2003 Model with Engine swapped to 5afe. The car is on Petrol. No CNG installed I am having this problem from start , when i turn on the engine , the RPM stick to 1000-1200 . but when i turn on the AC rpm Drops to 800 . Now when i Drive the car like Releasing Clutch and Pressing Race . the rpm goes dowm to 500 and sometimes engine just shutdown due to low rpm . and there is major major diffrence in car performance when from speed 0-30 , on signals sometime i have to press the race padle and clucth many time to make RPM and then drive the car , above 30 , every thing is normal . its come back to better pick and so on. its 4 months now , in Which i tried diffrent mechanic , some cleans the throttle body , some changed the air filter box , some suggested the Plugs change , i have done every thing and nothing work. i searched on internet and found some other people are also having same problem with this engine . i also travelled to a "EFI" checking shop in some auto market near Bhawalpur Road , Lahore . They said as this car is altered , we cant check the EFI system. So what should i do now ? currently i have adjusted my RPM to 2000 , when i turn on the AC , rpm comes to 1500 and its a bit different , as its hot and every time i sit in car i turn on ac but as weather is changing i defiantly need at some point to turn off the ac and then the noise of high rpm is annoying.
column2: It appears you've been grappling with persistent RPM and performance issues in your Toyota Corolla 2.0D, which underwent an engine swap to a 5AFE. Despite various attempts, including throttle body cleaning, air filter changes, and plug replacements, the problem persists, with fluctuating RPMs and stalling. Given the complexity of EFI systems and the potential impact of the engine swap, it's recommended to conduct a comprehensive diagnostic scan by a professional auto-electrician to identify any stored error codes in the Engine Control Unit (ECU). Additionally, ensure proper connections of the Circuit Opening Relay (COR) and main relay, as these play a crucial role in the EFI system. Checking for vacuum leaks, inspecting the throttle position sensor (TPS) calibration, and consulting with an EFI specialist may offer further insights into resolving the issue effectively.

column1: hey guyz i was planning to get a turbo for my 2c which turbo is applicable for a 2c ?? a toyota ct9 or ct12 or sum other?? i can only expect an approx 10hp gain from adding a turbo is there any thing other thing which can increase sum noticeable hp??
column2: It seems you're contemplating turbocharging your Toyota 2C engine and are considering options like the CT9 or CT12. While adding a turbo can potentially yield a significant torque boost in diesel engines, there are factors to consider. The CT12, with a larger turbine, might be suitable, but running too much boost can risk damaging non-turbo pistons. It's crucial to ensure the engine has turbo pistons, as they have additional oil cooling features. Carefully monitor boost levels to prevent engine stress. Additionally, for noticeable horsepower gains, other modifications like optimizing fuel injection, enhancing air intake, and improving exhaust flow can be explored. Consulting with experienced turbocharging specialists is advisable to avoid potential engine damage.

column1: I was thinking of replacing the manual knob type AC unit of my Altis Grande to auto/electric one which has been introduced in new Grande. Knobs are cave age concept.  When I approached Toyota Islamabad Motors, I was told that the WHOLE unit would be replaced as the manual system has wires while the auto one has ECU. The price will be 350,000. I decided to wait for some car to reach chor bazar so I get it for 50,000. However the exchange is possible.
column2: Instead of opting for costly repairs on a 2 million asset, it might be better to consider selling and booking a new one, although the timing for selling could have been better. Regarding replacing the manual knob type AC unit in an Altis Grande with an auto/electric one, the whole unit needs to be replaced, involving significant cost, unless one opts for a cheaper option from the scrapyard. However, some believe it's not worth the investment, as the single-zone climate control in the Grande may not offer significant advantages, with features like adjusting fan speed to match interior and exterior temperatures, but lacking advanced functionalities like true dual-zone control or additional features such as a charcoal filter or variable AC compressor. While the auto system may trip the compressor when the desired temperature is reached, it also adjusts air blend to maintain the set temperature, potentially reducing how often it needs to restart.

column1: "I had a 2018 Toyota Highlander for 2 years and after selling it, I was looking for an SUV. I found nothing better than an M5 hidden in an SUV body. The E70 X5M is a powerful beast with a 4.4L V8 Twin Turbo engine, producing 555 bhp at 6000 rpm and 500 lb-ft at 1500 rpm. It redlines at 7000 rpm. It took me about 4+ months to find this specific model. I will be sharing minor modifications and maintenance updates here. The 2011 X5M has 88,500 miles and was built in October 2010. It is Alpine White with a Black Perforated Interior. Only 212 units were produced in the US and 19 in Canada with this specific configuration. It has all the options like Heads-up Display, Extended Leather, Heated and Cooled Seats, 360 view Cameras, Park Distance Sensors, Individual Music System, Auto Leveling Air Suspension, Electronic Damping Control, etc. The only features it doesn't have are rear multimedia and LED adaptive headlights. Upgrades include Brakenetics rotors, Megan Racing axle-back exhaust, a 10.25"" Avin stereo, Stage 2+ tuning reaching 700 bhp and shooting flames, Catless DPs, and spacers of 13mm in the front and 15mm in the rear. This E70 X5M with Stage 2+ tuning and the Megan Racing Supremo Exhaust sounds amazing, as you can hear during cold start and driving away."
column2: After owning a 2018 Toyota Highlander for 2 years, I transitioned to the E70 X5M, describing it as an M5 hidden in an SUV body. Equipped with a 4.4L V8 Twin Turbo engine, producing 555 bhp, it took me over 4 months to find this specific 2011 X5M model with 88,500 miles. The SUV boasts Alpine White with a Black Perforated Interior, featuring options like Heads-up Display, Extended Leather, Heated and Cooled Seats, 360-view Cameras, Park Distance Sensors, Individual Music System, Auto Leveling Air Suspension, and Electronic Damping Control. Upgrades include Brakenetics rotors, Megan Racing axle-back exhaust, a 10.25" Avin stereo, Stage 2+ tuning reaching 700 bhp, Catless DPs, and spacers. The post also details a 10+ hour drive, tire replacement with Nitto NT420V, a coolant leak discovery, and DIY maintenance, including replacing engine beauty cover grommets and K&N filters.

column1: I recently got nissan dayz high way star overall car is very good but the problem i face is that the car changes its sound and gets heavy when AC is turned on other wise without AC the pick up is fine and sound is also normal There is a ("treee") sound when the AC is initially turned on.
column2: The 660 JDM micro-vans are generally sluggish due to several factors including their CVT transmission, suitability for intercity commuting rather than highways, and the power drawn by the air conditioning compressor, making them unsuitable for high performance. While there's no easy solution to enhance their speed, it's worth considering alternatives like the PKDM Corolla or Swift within the same price range. Regarding the Nissan Dayz, there's a known issue with its AC providing insufficient cooling, especially when first turned on. However, after running for some time, the cooling improves slightly, but there's no definitive solution to this problem. As for radiator flushing, Pakistani term for citric acid powder is "tartari," available at local markets or chemical supply stores. Mix it with hot water, remove the thermostat valve, drain the radiator and engine, fill with the solution, idle the engine for 20 minutes with the heater open, drain, neutralize with baking soda, and flush thoroughly, considering safety measures and professional advice for heavily rusted systems.

column1: Salam, pakwheelers! I was searching 'radiator flush' techniques and i came across a post where it was mentioned to use 'dry white citric acid powder'. After pouring some powder in the radiator the car should be started and idled to clear the crap on the inside and then it should be completely flushed (after removing drain pipe) until clear water is seen. No, i don't want to use flushing chemicals as the car is old. THE MAIN POINT OF THIS POST: Where can i buy citric acid powder? What is the Pakistani term for it? (people are more familiar with this so this is why i asked) Click here for SOLUTION190
column2: The Pakistani term for citric acid powder is "tartari." You can buy it from local markets or chemical supply stores. To use it for radiator flush, mix it in hot water first, remove the thermostat valve, drain the radiator and engine, fill it with the prepared solution, start the engine, and let it idle for about 20 minutes with the heater open. Afterward, drain the system, neutralize with some baking soda, and flush thoroughly. Exercise caution if the system is heavily rusted, as it may lead to leaks that need repairing. Always follow safety measures and consider professional advice if needed.

column1: Hello guys, as you might have guessed from my old signature I'm all against HID kits and all that.Whenever I see a thread with "HID" in the title,I immediately jump to it to share my views.Most people have some wrong ideas about HID and projector lights.I am going to copy and paste some of the information I shared in the old forums but did not get noticed. Here we go:  Common misconception:  "projectors are useless without hid , with normal bulbs u will face many problems in vision"  Actuality:  That is far from true, projectors have far better output even with halogen bulbs, take the camry for example it comes with halogen projectors and light output is WAY better compared to a reflector housing. Projectors come in two different types. 1.Halogen 2. HID .... Now aftermarket projectors that are sold ... 99.9% of them are Halogen projectors ... but as everyone does not know this , they put HID's in the Halogen Projectors and the output is ridiculous to say the least.The reason is because the focal point of the halogen bulb is different from the HID bulb. Misconception:  "Why Install Projectors in The First Place??.. Why Not Only Install HID's In Stock HeadLamps??.. They Give More Light Than Projectors.." Actuality:  That is also false, HID in reflector housings gives the worst output.The glare you get is blinding to say the least.Most of the folks put HID in halogen projectors and then complain that the output is worse. Here is the output of light in descending order: HID Projector>Halogen Projector>Reflector Housing. Now let me show you comparison pictures of outputs in different applications. Real HID Projector Output: No light above the cutoff line  Another image of a real HID projector( This is a RHD projector, hence the higher side is on the left)  Halogen Projector(with halogen bulb) Output:No light above the cutoff line   Halogen Projector(with HID bulb) Output ... This is a common mistake Notice the Light has dispersed. Light has escaped above the cutoff line.Oncoming traffic gets a little glare in their eyes.  HID in reflector Housing: By far the worst output .Has the worst output. The is no evidence of a cutoff line.That's why the oncoming traffic gets glare in their eyes.   More Pointers:  1. If your car came with Halogens from the factory, Halogens will give you the best visibility(in your stock headlight) no matter what anyone says.  2.The purpose of the high beam is to put light in the distance.When your high beam reflector is not meant for an HID then how in the world is the HID going to be effective. Also HID's take time to come up to full intensity(usually 5-15 seconds) and that defeats the purpose of a high beam.   3.Light output(measured in lumens) is inversely proportional to the color temperature(measured in kelvins or K) so the most light you would get will be out of 4300K(Same color temperature as daylight). Beyond 6000K its just plain useless.  One thing to note the reason that the "Blue" HID lights seem to be brighter is because of the simple reason that the human eye is very sensitive to blue light which is the very reason it dazzles our eyes and gives the illusion that it is brighter which in fact is totally false. After-market Projectors All of the projectors headlamps available at car accessory shops are Halogen, most of the people do not know this, and when they buy them and put an HID Kit in the projectors, they start complaining of the lack of visibility.  A simple way of identifying a halogen projector is that it simple uses any of the halogen bulb types for example like H11,H3 etc.  Real HID Projectors use HID bulbs like D2S,D1S etc.   Cars with HID reflector housings(from the factory): Now before you go all flaming on me that there are some cars out their like the 2nd Gen Toyota Prius,9th Gen Toyota Corolla(in some markets),8th Gen Civic Mugen RR etc that have HID's from the factory even though they have a reflector housing; Let me explain that as well The cars above all have one thing in common, their reflector housings were designed from the ground up to be used with an HID bulb.These reflectors are diamond cut for more precise cutoff to reduce most of the glare and use a bulb known as D2R (R for Reflector).Half the bulb glass is covered with paint to reduce the the glare even further.  Now you all be the judge.I have made the mistake of putting HID's in reflector housings but after doing extensive research I have come to the conclusion that HID should only be used in HID Projectors Only.     That is all I can churn out of my useless brain at the moment. Feel free to ask questions, I will be more than happy to answer them.
column2: i've tried explaining this to so many people but they still fit HID's to their cars without doing theor research. also i find it hilarious when peole fit HIDs to their high beams not realizing that these lights hate thermal change and is a huge reason for them failing. "LET THERE BE RICE!"

Not less then $300 and can range till $500. so what can a guy do if he is a budget buyer ? well what i did was buy a HId and shove it in the high beam and when you get tired throw it out and put the halogen back. All i have experienced this and i must say if you have the money to put on it then you can only achieve the results other wise just put an hid satisfy your self for a couple of months and every thing will be fine. second option is that put some good quality halogens they will cost you almost Rs5000 to your door step if you import(i dont think you will find them in the local market.)

column1: Hi I want to buy brand new lap top in limited budget . In this budget one of the following lap top I can afford : Kindly suggest me which one should I purchase ? I intend to use for some programing work plus android work . Hp laptop Amd Ryzen 3 5300U APU with 256 Gb SSD 4GB ram ( local and int warranty available ) Hp Intel Core i3 1215U processor [2] with 256 Gb SSD 4 gb ram ( only int warranty available ) . Plz suggest.
column2: The i3-1215U, despite having less performance cores, is a more capable chip for both single and multi-threaded applications. However, crucial at this price point is being able to expand your RAM, especially for programming work, and storage. 4GB is not nearly enough. The Ryzen APU only supports DDR4, while the 12th Gen i3 may support DDR4 or DDR5 depending on what the manufacturer has used. Look into whether either computer has one or more RAM slots for future expansion.

column1: Hello friends, My lancer 2006 has jerk and missing problem. I have searched on this forum but havenot found the solution. The car is perfect and is never driven on CNG. Engine is perfect with no oil loss. The only problem is the jerks and missing. Sometimes the car is perfectly fine and sometimes it jerks with missing. Missing here refers to very low acceleration, dragging and a feel of power coming and going. The missing issue is not related to fuel pump. I have changed iacv but still the problem is there. As the car jerks engine check light comes on and goes away after 4 5 seconds. So i think it is related to a sensor. I have changed iacv now maf and tps sensor are left. I hope there are no more sensors :). Can any brother help me in finding the issue with his experience?
column2: get it scanned. why wasting money by changing sensors. get t scanned and identify the fault with the code.

column1: Im going to clean my Catalytic Converter for Mira because its average is pretty low even after tuning, oil change and every other single stuff. But some people are saying it can damage my car as it did theirs. But upon more conversation, they told me their mechanic removed and cleaned it for them whereas im about to go for machine cleaning and the guy is saying that it has 0% drawbacks and if anything goes wrong, im responsible. He is btw known in Karachi for his Catalytic converter Cleaning and has the FB page named as CatClean AutoMobile services. What are your thoughts on it? Should i go ahead or what?
column2: Cleaning the catalytic converter can be beneficial for restoring efficiency, especially if it's clogged. If the service provider, CatClean AutoMobile services, is reputable and has positive reviews, machine cleaning should not cause damage. Clarify the specific cleaning method they use and ensure it's suitable for your car. Consider preventive measures like occasional "Italian tune-ups" and regular maintenance for a healthier exhaust system. Proceed with the cleaning if you trust the provider, but communicate concerns and monitor your vehicle's performance afterward.

column1: Dear All, I was by the River and had to shift to H4 and forgot to turn back and ended up doing 250km with H4 still active. Everything was fine on motorway but when I got back to the city car was acting weird on turns and then I started smelling tyres burning and then I noticed H4 was active. Today I didn't feel the same smoothness anymore so I just wanted to ask what had happened and how it can be fixed I am sure there must be someone else who made the same mistake. Thanks
column2: technically speaking it shouldnt make any difference at all H4 is for normal drive with a lil extra traction on slippery surface-snow-rain etc

column1: Dear All, I was by the River and had to shift to H4 and forgot to turn back and ended up doing 250km with H4 still active. Everything was fine on motorway but when I got back to the city car was acting weird on turns and then I started smelling tyres burning and then I noticed H4 was active. Today I didn't feel the same smoothness anymore so I just wanted to ask what had happened and how it can be fixed I am sure there must be someone else who made the same mistake. Thanks
column2: in my experience H4 is only adding more traction to wheels for off pavement or soft ground ride. vehicle may feel heavy on normal terrain. disengage and enjoy. however a question no lamp indication over dash board for drive mode lit up when 4x4 is engaged ? or you ignore that?

column1: It has happened to me and now another friend car. My Honda CRZ(k24 swapped) neededa clutch change and the workshop did the job but when they put back the speed snesor ( CSS, Countershaft speed sensor, its in front of transmission and comes with 8th gen onwards Honda, Honda city 2011 onward and 9th gen civic etc etc.) So long story short when the car was put in gear, the snesor touched the gear teaath and ecu got fried and because Hondata Flashpro was locked to it, and no scanner can connect to this ecu, that also got wasted. So i began searching for the solution but online there was no such info of what size washer to put between sensor and transmission. I even looked at Honda manual diagrams and they even dont put any washer there. So after a lot of triala nd testing i have found the solution once and for all. Its so delicate balance between too far or too near. IF even half a millimeter far the speedo and VTEC wont work. HAlf a mm close and you risk fry ecu or sensor. Honda Speed Sensor Washer Mystery Solved. and today morning just recieved a call from friend that They could not start the car aftter chaging the clutch, i immediately guessed what happened and i was right. So if you have a manual Honda with a CSS sensor, which needs a clutch work than buy these cheap wahsers i mentioned in video. that are 10 washers in just RS 450 and can save a lot of money. i wasted 2 lakhs plus. So dont suffer like i did.   https://www.daraz.pk/products/original-jdm-bolts-l-key-styling-universal-bolt-10pis-pakit-i171018394-s1341336922.html4?
column2: When dealing with sensor-related issues, it's crucial to ensure proper handling and maintenance practices. Mechanics should exercise care when removing sensors to prevent misplacement of spacer washers, which are essential for maintaining correct air gaps and sensor functionality. Different manufacturers employ varying sensor configurations, with Honda utilizing a 5V VCC rail for sensor sourcing and feedback. However, mishaps such as wire shorts can disrupt this system, highlighting the need for careful handling. Reinstalling sensors with their original spacers intact is standard practice, as seen in transmissions like Nissan/Jatco CVTs, which require specific shims for maintaining proper air gaps. It's advisable to engage qualified mechanics equipped with modern tools to avoid such issues. Additionally, when dealing with international shipments and customs clearance, proper documentation is essential to verify the origin and status of items, particularly for goods not manufactured in Pakistan. Collaborating with reputable freight companies knowledgeable about the required documentation processes is crucial for smooth transactions and compliance with copyright and import regulations. Industrial equipment control modules often undergo similar shipping procedures for refurbishment, underscoring the importance of engaging experienced freight services for handling such transactions.
